Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: Raymond S
Reviews.Content: This is a well run, small family hotel whose staff is concerned with making sure its guests have a great experience while in Rome. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary during the 9 nights we spent at the hotel and when they learned of our special day they graciously gave us a bottle of wine to enjoy on the terrace prior to dinner that night. The terrace is a quiet spot where we could just relax after a long day of touring. We relied on the hotel for several restaurant recommendations and they were all spot on. We heard very little English being spoken and had the sense that these were places where real Romans went to enjoy a meal. When we return to Rome we will be staying at the Hotel Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Damian K
Reviews.Content: We intended to stay here for 1 or 2 nights to get our bearings in Rome. It only took us 1 night to realise we were in the perfect location. Our room opened onto the rooftop garden which was an extra bonus. The staff were friendly and professional in all matters and helped us through a small health scare on our arrival. I cannot speak highly enough of their hospitality. Don't waste your time shopping around, this is the place to be in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, very friendly, roof terrace and location huge plus”
Reviews.Author: Henry S
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, go for the room with the jet baths..well worth the extra €. Also try get one that opens out on to the roof terrace

Reviews.Title: “It is all about location”
Reviews.Author: gf1349
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Parlamento for the first time in over seven years. It was as we remembered. The location is ideal only a few minutes from the Spanish Steps,Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Piazza Navona. You can walk nearly everywhere in Rome from here, but great dining, shops and sights are mere steps away. If that is not enough, the staff are very accomodation. Our room was quite nice with all the amenities we want or need. We cannot recommend the place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ali V
Reviews.Content: We are budget travelers and keep very tight on our spending. This hotel however a little higher than our budget, but it made a great memory from Rome. The staff were very polite and they helped us very patiently. The rooms very cozy and clean and the service very nice. Its location is in walking distance from Spanish steps and Fontana, and reasonable distance to coliseum, mouth of truth, etc. The price is affordable and the furniture and hospitality is very high standard. Actually I confirm you pay for a two star and get 4star service. The roof garden is very beautiful, don't miss a coffee there at night.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Friendly staff! Value! And a wonderful roof terrace!”
Reviews.Author: ColleeninPiegaro
Reviews.Content: The staff is fantastic! Very friendly and helpful. We arrived early at noon and asked if we could drop our bags until we could checkin, and they said that they would make the room up for us so we could tidy up after train ride and while we were waiting they offered a cappucino. Just incredible. We stayed in Rome 107 that opens to the roof terrace and it was wonderful. Although the roof terrace is open to all in the hotel, we did not feel our privacy was sacraficed. The other rooms that open to terrace are 104 and 106. The room was very clean, big enough for our bags and a little desk for our laptop and free WiFi. The bed is very firm which was alright with us. Small bath with very small shower, but for value and location this hotel cannot be beat. It is just a very short walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Partheon and Piazza Navona. Lots of restaurants everywhere within a few blocks. Breakfast is included: big basket of croissants, rolls and breads with jam, cereals, yogurt and cheese and any tea or type of coffee you would want. We live in Umbria so we will make this our base to explore Rome from time to time. Very close to a taxi stand which we found very helpful when we wanted to go to Termini. Typical TV with one English language CNN station, but we came to walk around Rome, so we did not watch it. The manager Plinio has excellent suggestions for restaurants, his nephews Andrea and Titiziano are very attentive as is the night deskman, Roberto. We highly recommend this for value, friendly staff and location!

Reviews.Title: “best choice of hotel we could have made”
Reviews.Author: BigBen2012
Reviews.Content: After reading such good reviews on tripadvisor, I decided to book this hotel. Turns out it was a great decision. First of all, the location is one of the best! Minutes away from the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, La Fonta di Trevi and practicly in the middle of the best touristic shopping areas. We walked everywhere from the hotel, including the Colosseum, the Vatican and other neighborhoods. Service at the hotel was wonderful, friendly, warm and very informative and helpful. Rooms are very clean and we felt like coming home each time we returned to the hotel. Next time we'll be in Rome, we'll be staying at this hotel without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “It's near things you want to see.”
Reviews.Author: armacy
Reviews.Content: Be sure you have clear directions before you go -- I had emailed the hotel for them, and never heard back. It was difficult to find, and I couldn't find a cab when I arrived at the train station (snow delays...). You have to ask for the heat control if it's unseasonably cold (I woke up shivering). The room I was in was right by the stairs from the lobby, so I could hear the conversations at the front desk and from people coming home late at night. Tight squeeze in the bathroom. Finding a hotel in Rome on tripadvisor can be overwhelming, but I don't know that I'll be coming back to Hotel Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wurzeljocks
Reviews.Content: We warmly recommend the Hotel Parlamento. Such good value in an otherwise expensive cirty. It's quite difficult to find - just off the Corso in the Via delle Convertite opposite the North Face store! But such a find when you get there with great staff and comfortable rooms. Don't stay anywhere else in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “In Rome for the Rugby”
Reviews.Author: Shaun K
Reviews.Content: What a great find! Friendly staff, very comfortable and very good value. Just off the Corso and so perfectly situated for the usual tourist sites. We will be going back>

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recomended”
Reviews.Author: kellymarkp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location in the centre of Rome. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the hotel staff were charming and helpful. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definently be back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcamargo
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is the best cost-benefit you'll find, excellent stay for the price you pay. Starting with the location, in the middle of the via del corso, most important street on the historical centre. You can walk to the Colosseo (20-25 min), to the piazza venetia (10-15 min), to piazza spagna (5 min,) where you can find a subway, piazza popola (10-15 min), pantheon, fontana trevi (5-10 min), etc. We walked even to vatican and I would say it took about 40 mins. The staff was very kind and helpful, the breakfast is basic, but good. The rooms aren't so modern, but are very confortable, with lcd tv (unfortunately the italian channels are italian spoken, and not many have SAP) and wireless. Right in front of the hotel there is an AutoGrill, where you can buy groceries, fastfood, etc. Many restaurants nearby. If you like to buy clothes, you'll be on an excellent area for that.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location, can walk to almost all major sites”
Reviews.Author: brooksdj7
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels for the money on our entire trip. We spent around 180 bucks a night on the place and for the area, it was unbeatable. As per other reviews the rooms are small, but when traveling in Europe you need to have the right expectations. This also is not a luxury hotel, it is a clean, afforable option in an awesome location. In almost all places you will have smaller rooms than you are used to. Overall though the hotel was very clean and the staff very helpful and friendly. The Pantheon, Trevi fountain, Piazza Navona, and Spanish steps are all in between 5 to 10 minute walks. There are 2 metros nearby: one at Barberini and the other at Spanish steps. We used them to a few times, one to get to the Vatican, once for the Coliseum, then on our trip out to get to Termini with luggage. You can walk anywhere from this hotel, just be prepared as the coliseum is probably a 25 min walk and the Vatican even longer. In our trip we walked pretty much everywhere, but sometimes you need to choose your battles and save your feet for the rest of the day. As for restaurants in the area, be careful as it is near may tourist sites and we found those we stumbled upon when we were tired and hungry were bad, and those we carefully researched were very good. The hotel has a rooftop terrace and a few rooms that open up to it. We stayed in one of those rooms and it was really nice to have easy access to the deck, which we hung out and drank wine on, so ask and see if one of those is available. Unfortunately during our stay the Piazza that the roofdeck overlooks was under construction, which hopefully is done by now. The best tip I have for a stay in Rome is to make use of the many fountains over Rome called nasoni (they are marked SPQR), which constantly have cold delicious and most importantly free water. There is one of these located in the piazza right by the hotel and we filled up our water bottles each morning and night. Breakfast is included with your stay as well and it's pretty basic, which was common with hotels in Italy though I'd say this hotel had a little less than other places we stayed. Breakfast had croissants, fruit, yogurt and other basics, just load up on some carbs and get your day started early. My last recommendation would be to check out a website called Reid's Italy if you are planning your trip on your own and really want to try and make the most of it and maximize what you see, or even just get down the important places to see. He has advice on top sights, hotels and places to eat. We used his site to plan generally and then used tripadvisor to make our final decisions on hotels and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Best People in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Raymond M
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful time staying at the Hotel Parlamento in early November. Mr Chini, the owner, and his staff members Andrea, Roberto, and Philomena were so incredibly nice and helpful. Mr. Chini commutes by bicycle to work and gave me advice on navigating the city by bicycle. His advice helped immensely. All of the team members recommended and made reservations for unbelievable restaurants. They were hidden gems that were off the tourist paths and much more genuine for someone looking for "real" Italian restaurants. Philomena knew I liked my coffee very strong and would make me a pot of coffee with espresso addes to it every morning. Andrea was always impecibly dressed and directed us to nice boutique shops without expensive prices. The Hotel is perfectly sited for all the major sites of Rome. The Berlesconi affair was playing out while we were there so it was quite exciting to be right by the government buildings. I would heartily recommend the Parlamento to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to celebrate an anniversary”
Reviews.Author: iloveWI
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Hotel Parlamento in October. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary and had never traveled without a tour group or overseas. The staff was so wonderful. The entrance was a little hard to find, but our kind taxi driver saw our bewildered look as we exited the cab, and walked us to the door. We loved the rooftop terrace. Many Americans were staying there at the time and we would all congregate on the terrace for food, wine, and fellowship at the end of the day. The breakfasts each morning were a delight. We walked everywhere from the hotel and felt safe at night in the neighborhood. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Marchimp
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at hotel Parlemento, it is not a flash hotel and you will need to pay the extra tariff for the air con as the rooms were really hot. It was clean, comfortable and right in the heart of Rome. Great location and for a good price. Breakfast was okay to. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Restaurants Close-by”
Reviews.Author: donnieandmarie
Reviews.Content: The location is the best. It's central to almost everything that you want to visit and being close to the Italian Parlament which means good restaurants close-by. Our room, next to the roof-top garden, was wonderful as we had a beautiful view of the Roman skyline. The breakfast was excellent. Best of all was the staff. Very, very helpful and professional. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Emily368
Reviews.Content: This was the best place we could have stayed in Rome. It is not the fanciest, it is not the largest, not the most luxurious hotel we have ever stayed in, but it was perfect for our time there. The location is the best, the metro stop drops you off right in front of the Spanish Steps and you walk through the main shopping district and the hotel is tucked in a side street right off from all the shopping streets. (Side Note: take a bus from the airport, pass by everyone offering you shuttles and taxis and buses, they will rip you off, just follow signs for the buses outside of the airport, they will sell you tickets in front of the bus and it goes directly to the main train station. We bought ours for 8 euros per person and it included a return ticket on the bus). The hotel has an extremely small elevator, we traveled with friends that had a small baby and only one person could go in with the stroller, or two or three adults with no luggage. On arrival we had to take the elevator 4 times to get everything upstairs. (There is the option of taking the stairs as well up about 3-4 flights). The staff was extremely nice, everyone spoke English, they were all more then willing to help us with directions and offered us maps as soon as we walked in. They also sell water bottles and drinks for very reasonable prices, which was nice because we were able to carry those bottles around with us the whole time and refill them throughout the city using the public drinking fountains. We had requested one room attached to the roof top terrace and a second room on the main floor for our friends who had a baby with them. We were able to share the terrace with our friends, who also noted that our room attached to the terrace was nicer then theirs downstairs. It was also extremely convenient that the hotel included breakfast, this was not a deal breaker for us when planning our trip, but it turned out to be a huge help in the mornings to have a good breakfast waiting for us. It was no bacon and eggs, but they had a small table with cereal choices, fresh breads and croissants every morning, fruit, juices, and they would make you as many cappuccino's as you wanted. I would recommend this to any of our friends or family making a trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: JohnD360
Reviews.Content: The owner and staff of this small and very nice hotel is what makes it so special. All were very helpful and the restaurant recommendations were consistently outstanding. All were English speakers. We walked everywhere in Rome, except for ride along the Appian way to see some catacombs. All of Rome was just outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price”
Reviews.Author: WLeeR
Reviews.Content: Loved this location because we could walk almost everywhere. We stayed in the roof top rooms, 104 and 106, October 3-7, 2011. So convenient and relaxing to sit in the roof garden after we got back to our rooms. Did get noisy at night if people were sitting out there. The rooms were comfortable and the bathrooms up-to-date. Breakfast was very filling and the servers were accomodating and friendly. The hosts were extremely helpful with directions, restaurant suggestions, and getting a taxi to the train station. The hotel is on the fourth floor and is serviced by stairs or a two-person elevator. This was interesting with luggage, but didn't pose a big problem. The only downside to our visit, which wasn't the hotel's fault, was construction that was going on at the piazza around the corner. They worked at night so having a restful sleep was nearly impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rhtrips333
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Parlamento from October 2-5, 2011. We payed the 55 Euro for their car service from the airport and I recommend it. It worked out really well and took the stress off finding a taxi right away. Entry into the hotel seems a bit akward at first since it shares the buliding with other businesses, but is fine after initial visit. The help at the desk was very nice. The standard rooms are very nice and clean albeit small. I would recommend making sure the room you book is not right by check in desk. The breakfast is very nice, especially the wonderful rooftop patio. For breakfast, it is part self-serve, part full service. This also was odd at first but worked out just fine. Also, you have to leave your room key at the desk before you leave for them to clean your room. In hindsight, I would have payed the 12 Euro per night for the A/C because the room retained the daytime heat. As everyone says, the location is awesome. We never needed a cab to get anywhere, except the vatican or the train station. Overall, for the very resonable price, we were very happy with the hotel and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about the stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: kristenreinvented
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Parlamento for a week at the end of September with my good friend and my Mother. I researched hotels for the trip and was not disappointed when we arrived. The location is great- close to the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc as well as very close to many good restaurants. Our room was right next to the reception area, but I didn't notice excessive noise or disturbance. The room was large and very clean. It was so hot we paid the extra 12 euros a night to use the air conditioner and it was worth every cent! Hotel has free wifi and a computer that you can use. The hotel staff was great and always pleasant (Tiziano, in particular, was always helpful with recommendations and directions). If I return to Rome I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: qwest282
Reviews.Content: The location is great, as mentioned in other reviews, close to many of "the" sites. The lift makes it easy to get to the reception area. We really appreciated that after dragging our heavy luggage up too many stairs in other hotels. Plini (spelling) and the staff were most helpful. The breakfast was very good. We also enjoyed the complimentary cappucino on the roof-top patio.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and warm welcome in Rome”
Reviews.Author: djh69
Reviews.Content: The Parlamento is a very tipical city centre hotel in Italy in that it occupies the upper storey of a very grand building. In this case the 4th and 5th floors at number 5 Via delle Convertite. This is a brilliant location, just a short walk from Trevi Fountain, Piazzas Navona, Popolo, Spagna and the Spanish Steps, and many other major sights. There is a great selection of classy shops and a whole range of restaurants from simple pizzas to silver service in the immediate area. Rooms are quite small, but comfortable and functional. There's a delightful roof terrace and breakfast room. The Chini family, who own the place, and their staff make a huge difference - friendly, helpful and courteous. Little touches like the extra coffee requested at breakfast and delivered with a smile, and the offer to keep our luggage and even provide a shower and toilet for use late into the evening, were greatly appreciated. Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Again, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HeleneUSA1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the best locations in Rome. You can walk to most of the major attractions. Trevi fountain is only one of the many easy walks and can be enjoyed both day and night. The hotel is in a safe and desirable location. If you like shopping you are in the best place, right next to the Via Del Corso. You are close to all bus stops and a short walk to the Spanish Steps and the Metro. The service was very good and the staff spoke English. They were helpful with travel arrangements or answering questions, especially Roberto. You could use their computer if need to check something. There is a lovely little roof top terrace where you can meet other guests and enjoy an evening drink. A word of caution, if you have difficulty walking there is one more flight of steps going up to the rooms besides the small elevator to the hotel lobby on the 4th floor. The rooms are clean, but small, and very typical for this kind of hotel. All in all a very nice place to stay in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with exillent service”
Reviews.Author: dukered
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in September 2011. the rooms are clean, breackfast is good and served on the balkony on the roof, soo good. Everybody allready talked about the location, no need to take any transpotation. The best is the staff. Roberto and the two other guys (sorry forget the names) helped us arrange everything(trip to Umbria , Galleries,etc.,).Thank you ,will be back. The room is good size ( we had an upgraded double), the AC is extra, but not bad ,nose no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable - and oh so central!”
Reviews.Author: jojoDorset
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel - friendly, well-run and perfectly placed for the Centro Storico. The Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and so on are all only a few minutes stroll away. You spend so much time walking in Rome that the Parlamento's roof terrace provides a fabulous little oasis for having a refreshing respite from sightseeing. We spent 4 nights there and were delighted with the choice. It has an old-fashioned feel - courteous and kindly, safe and family-run. Smiles from all the staff. We were glad to have a Superior room though with air conditioning and double glazing as this meant our room was a good size, cool and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rikulia
Reviews.Content: We have spend 4 night in this hotel last week so my memories are still fresh:) As the 2 star hotel it is really amazing! I don't think you can get better location than this as it is in the middle of the center and close to everything! The staff was helpful and nice. The room was small but very clean, no problem. Better than I have expected. We especially loved the terrace upstairs as you can sit there and have your glass of wine. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: desoriordan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Parlamento for 4 nights in early September 2011. The rooms were very clean, had an old world charm, although badly lacking a mini bar!! If you want air conditioning (and i did) it will cost you an extra 12 euros per night. the staff were very helpful and even charged my phone for me as i forgot to bring an adapter. in terms of location you can't really do much better the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Pantheon, were all within a 10 minute walk away. there's a metro stop at the Spanish steps which is very handy as well. the breakfast is typical fair, self service with coffee, cereal, yogurt, bread etc but it's well worth having as Rome can be hot and you'll need the energy. A good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Shhh....Don't tell too many people about how great this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: Celia P
Reviews.Content: We want to keep it just the way it is. Family run, right in the middle of everything but still quiet and safe. The management is so friendly and helpful and they speak English! (ciao Andrea!) From other Tripadvisor reviews, I was expecting the room to be really small, but we thought it was just the right size, and we had a triple! Me, my husband and my 15 year old son stayed at the Parlamento for 6 nights in the hot Roman Summer, so paying extra for the air conditioning was worth every penny. From this fantastic location, we walked everywhere. No need for buses, cabs or subways. The major walking route is Via Del Corso, always packed with people, so it felt safe to walk to the hotel at anytime of day or night. Although it might sound nice (at first) to select some hotel on a quaint crooked street, I would pick the Hotel Parlamento in the busy shopping area again in a heartbeat. The best nearby site is the Pantheon, where a local sings opera every night (magical!). Don't miss the Museo Borghese and the Park. Hotel Parlamento will happily phone in a reservation for Borghese the day before you wan to go. Easy! We drank wine on the Parlamento terrace at 6:30 pm every evening. I miss it already!!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the location”
Reviews.Author: RandyW4
Reviews.Content: Location was really good. I thought the people at the front desk I talked to were all helpful and their English was very good. Ate breakfast on the roof one day. Good spot to enjoy some coffee in the morning (god bless them but Italians and breakfast ehh). I would say pretty typical bathroom. I spent about all of my time in Rome walking around so I was looking for a good location and nice place to sleep. It's a short walk down the Via del Corso from the Trevi Fountain. And the gelateria Giolitti is pretty close too for some late night gelato.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Sueperwmn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a long family vacation through Germany, Austria and Italy. The location is great. The staff is very helpful and friendly. When we arrived a little stressed after driving in from Sorrento and unloading 4 kids, my mother and all of our luggage etc, Tiziano (front desk) just told me to RELAX, he would take care of everything while my husband and I dropped of the car. When we got back he handed me the keys to our room with a couple of cold beers!!!! now thats a welcome. The rooms were on the small size but clean, our double opened up to the roof top balcony which was a great place to unwind after a long day of sightseeing. Speaking of sightseeing, what a perfect location. We were able to walk everywhere and many of the streets in the area were pedestrian only. Of course July in Rome can be very warm (aka hot) and some of the rooms got pretty warm. The air conditioning was an extra cost, but it really worked. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “The location is very good but some of the rooms needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: nura_9
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it got a great rating from travelers. The location was very good but the room was not. The bath tub was very old and had stains all over it. The beds/mattress were thin and uncomfortable and there was loud noise from the pipes in the wall that started very early in the morning. My advise is to ask for the renovated rooms (they look much nicer) and if they don't have them available just stay in another hotel. Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Vera_always
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening and were a little worried upon entering the establishment and the tiny elevator. Once we reached the hotel floor, we were greeted by a nice gentlemen. We stayed here three nights and the place just grew on us. The staff is extremely cordial, friendly and helpful. And we think that's what makes Hotel Parlamento special. The rooms and the hotel itself is not modern, but very clean and adequate. They have a terrace on the roof where you can sit, drink wine and relax before going to bed. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Parlamento.”
Reviews.Author: Cam087
Reviews.Content: The location was great, the reception staff very friendly and helpful, the breakfast very good, and the price reasonable. Our room was on the small side but clean, with a nice bathroom. Free wi-fi and access to internet in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Well-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: mom1a
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at The Parlamento and were well pleased. The rooms are small but very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is excellent with most major attractions in easy walking distance. The price, for central Rome, is very reasonable. The breakfast is just adequate with nothing made fresh except the coffee. If you purchase the AC for 12 euros per day, the rooms are reasonably quiet. If you don't and leave the windows open, the traffic noise is considerable. All-in-all, a good place to stay and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: dklaw
Reviews.Content: Small hotel on upper floor of a centrally-located building in Rome. Even though our room faced the street, it was quiet at night, thanks to double-pane windows. Rooms are small, with tile floors. Bathroom, and especially the shower, is small, but not unusual for a mid-priced hotel in central city Europe. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is within walking distance of Spanish Steps, Forum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the other main sites. Vatican is a bit more of a hike, but if that is the main purpose of your trip, you would be well-advised to stay on the other side of the river. Rooms are accurately depicted on the website. We went in late October, so we could open the window and air conditioning was not an issue. I definitely would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good, clean, reasonably-priced room in a central location. Breakfast is included with the room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Good central budget option”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy-Lee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room for single use for 3 nights in July. The location is great for all the central sightseeing spots, especially Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and Colonna which are virtually on the doorstep. Also a good spot for shopping on via del Corso and via del Tritone if you fancy it. Being right next to the Piazza San Silvestro bus stops was very helpful & getting to Termini is only 10-12 mins. The room was fairly small with one of the tiniest bathrooms I've come across with a rather snug fit inside the shower. The positioning of the bidet meant the shower door couldn't open fully. Not for larger build people - see photo's! Despite the 30+C temps I didn't use the (extra cost) air con as I hate it and so slept with the window open & ear plugs in, meaning some early wake ups from screeching sea gulls but not road nosie as the room faced the innner courtyeard. But the room was clean, hotel staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was sufficient - 3 kinds of cereals, tinned fruit salad, yoghurts and the usual breads & pastries. Having free use of the hotel PC was helpful. Only small niggle - I would have liked a small fridge for keeping water and juice cool. The roof terrace was really nice and a lovely spot to have beakfast, read or have a glass of wine. Some good restaurants are nearby if you don't want to walk further afield. The artisan chocolate/gelato shop just around the corner has very good gelato, highly recommended (especially, of course, the chocolate!) I would stay again and recommend to friends where location is important.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: CNReese
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy, and the first time to travel abroad with our three college and teenage kids, so 2 affordable rooms in a big city with a central location were our two priorities. The Hotel Parlamento met both. The rooms were nicely sized for mid-Rome and the bathrooms were modern and spotless. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Andrea and his brother,along with the other staff members spoke excellent English and were exceptionally helpful. It is tucked away on the fourth floor so it is quiet. They have an elevator, but you may also have to climb one set of stairs. For our family and the several others staying there, it was not a problem. Located close to Trevi Fountain, and good shopping for the youth set, this was an excellent choice for us. Andrea was also a wonderful advisor on tours, directions and restaurant recommendations. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “OK..not over the top!”
Reviews.Author: Penny_11809
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our 10 nights in Italy. I must have been half-asleep when I made these reservations. I was distraught when I was looking at our reservation papers on the way to the hotel to find out it was only a 2 star, but it turned out ok. The location was decent and the area was safe. The reception man (sorry I forgot your name) was very friendly and helpful. He put us in a larger room than we reserved that was clean and had wonderful furniture. I was slightly disappointed about the view. The air condition (which we paid an extra 12Euro for) was adequate and we slept comfortable. All in all it turned out ok, but if you are looking for any upscale feel at all, this is not the place for you. Overall, satisfactory for the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located family hotel with great services”
Reviews.Author: CLee517
Reviews.Content: We love Rome and have been there at least a dozen times. We have been staying at the Hotel Parlamento for the past 9 years. Rates are very resonable for the central location, rooms are clean and pleasant, and the managment is very personable in providing recommendations for restaurants and transportation etx. They are very reliable in providing personsal limo service pick-up from the airport and port (if you are catching a cruise). Our most recent stay, my husband left a new sports T-shirt in our room, which was returned to us by mail in San Francisco promptly. Each visit we through a few coins in the Trevi Fountain with our wish to return again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: lgj777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for three nights before taking an overnight trip to Pompeii, and returned to the Parlamento upon our return to Rome. Both of our rooms were clean, comfortable, and beautifully appointed. Breakfasts, included in the rates, were simple and delicious. The people who worked at the Parlamento were warm, knowledgeable, and very accommodating. They allowed us to leave the bulk of our luggage at the Parlamento while we traveled to Pompeii, and upon our return, they had taken our luggage to our new room. While we thoroughly enjoyed our direct access to the terrace, you would not have to choose one of the 'direct access' rooms to make use of the lovely terrace. The Parlamento was, as others have said, perfectly positioned for walking around all of Rome. We walked to the Colosseum and the Forum, the Circus Maximus, the Teatro Dell'Opera, the Piazza Navona, the Piazza Popolo...the only place we did not walk to was Vatican City because we were running late for a Museum Tour. But more important than its perfect location, we felt at home, we felt comfortable, and we felt safe among new friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-but noisy”
Reviews.Author: ferspratt
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights in May 2011. The location is prime, we did not use a cab for anything since all the major attractions were walking distance. Very handy to be so centrally located. But the location is also very noisy. Our room was in the terrace, and as much as I enjoyed opening the french doors and having that extra "room" and fresh air, it was usually spoiled by the smokers on the terrace or by the loud people just hanging out outside your bedroom door. I had to open teh doors at 1 am and ask them to quiet down. Overall the location made it a better hotel than it actrually is. But we made it and di not let those inconveniences ruin our wonderful trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Family ran with a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: stl2naples
Reviews.Content: The location is A+++. You can walk to almost all attractions. Everyone was very helpful. One minus was our room was next to the breakfast room. It was not too loud but we would have preferred an upstairs room. Plus, our parents room was updated-ours was not-but still very clean. I will stay here again on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “it's centrally located”
Reviews.Author: toni175
Reviews.Content: this place is right in the heart of rome-with public transportation right down stairs (piazza s. silvesto)-it is cheaper then a hotel and gives you all the same accommodations--the staff is all related and all speak fluent english--titziano is a charmer ;) --breakfast is more than adequate and there is also a nice rooftop to hang out and have a glass of wine--they have one public computer---they have all the answers and suggestions for your stay in rome to be great--the only thing they need improving is the quality of their beds--I think they just need to get new ones---otherwise this will become my new place of stay whenever I'm in rome

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddies39
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor did not disappoint. This was a great hotel, a good start to Italy. The service and rooms were great, and the location was excellent. Walked to the Colosseum in no time flat. Had a room off the upper deck. Was a little noisy at night (external) but that's to be expected in the heart of Rome. Excellent hotel and I'll definitely stay here again if I am ever so fortunate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Treated as if we were family!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ValleyGirl4u
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on May the 6th and were welcomed immediately by the Hotel Host Tiziano. We where escorted to the Garden Terrace for breakfast as our room was prepared and our bags delivered. Tiziano then came and directed us to our room and that began our amazing first trip to Roma....The staff at Hotel Parlamento not only helped us with everything from reservations for dinner but arranged our arrival at the airport but also our departure to the the airport. Tiziano was not only someone I could rely on for a TRUE recommendation but what he said he would do, he did...He is a man of his word and that is a very honorable thing in this day and age. My husband and I relied on his recommendation for every site we went to. He sent us on an adventure in the middle of our week to the sea coast that he had traveled as a teenager and we did it for less than 6euro for both of us. During this adventure we stopped in Ostia Antica to look at the very well preserved and sometimes forgotten ruins and ran into Rick Steves filming in the Roman baths. Got he autograph and proceed on our way. All this to say Tiziano made this trip special. Because he is from this area he gave us insight into the local customs and that made this trip and our stay at Hotel Parlamento such a great experience for us.One other thing because of the great location we were able to walk to all of the major sights of the city. They are centrally located downtown near shopping and also all of the major sights of Rome. There are many other things to say but we will always remember our stay at this very warm and comfortable Hotel. Thank you Tiziano and Roberto for your kindness and hospitality...we will miss you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Place to come home to”
Reviews.Author: seasong2
Reviews.Content: Delightful staff, very helpful. Wonderful location for walking to almost everything. Good breakfast. And gelato across the street. But the absolutely best was the people who own and work there. We would stay there again. Being on the fourth floor helped with traffic noise. Rooftop patio provided respite.

Reviews.Title: “location location location! Service service service!”
Reviews.Author: Polkadot77
Reviews.Content: best for location, services, that's all, the room is old and tiny, bed is uncomfortable. But it really does trade off with location, it's near every tourist attractions, just a corner to via de corso, 2 blocks from Trevi, what else do u want?? Service is also great! Noted that there is only one lift to the hotel, but not from hotel to other floor, make sure u travel light! (but they helpes u carry anyway, just FYI)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gerryjackieash
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Rome, staying at the Hotel Parlamento in room 104 which opened out onto the roof terrace. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel (40 Euro) - I think we may have had trouble finding the hotel if we handn't been dropped off at the door - no hotel sign or anything to identify it as a hotel from the outside - just enormous green doors! All staff extremely friendly and helpful. On first inspection we thought that the room was quite small for what we had paid but it proved to be very comfortable and perfectly adequate for our stay. En-suite bathroom - compact but very clean - plenty of hot water, clean towels. Weather was beautiful so ate breakfast on the roof terrace each morning in the sunshine. The really great thing about this hotel is its location - we walked everywhere during our stay as it was so close to all the main attractions - Vatican can be reached in 30-40 minutes, Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps literally 5 mins walk from the hotel and the amazing Pantheon about 10 minutes walk away. Didn't use the public transport as we didn't need to! Hotel highly recommended - I can't imagine anyone being disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with a 5 star staff, atmosphere, & location!”
Reviews.Author: malawne
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this delightful find 4 times! It is my home away from home in Roma! All the comments about the staff are true. Tiziano and Andrea are so very charming! The rest of the staff, Roberto, Alessandra, Angelica, & Mr. Chini are all very delightful people. Clean and safe place to stay. You truly cannot beat the location. Look no further, book Hotel Parlimento! *.*

Reviews.Title: “They were gracious, friendly and very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: albiev
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel with a very nice free continental breakfast. The staff was very gracious and helpful. When we left, not only did they call a cab for us but they helped us carry our suitcases to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem Amidst the Wonder of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bartholdi7
Reviews.Content: We had a little difficulty finding the hotel because we couldn't see the street sign which ended up being obvious. We entered through and old courtyard up a lift and entered into a cozy foyer. We were welcomed with open arms by the owner Plenio. The room was small but it didn't matter because in Rome one might have a moment to rest due to the endless sights to visit. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. We were within minutes of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Palazzo Venezia and most attractions in Rome. The Vatican is a brisk 45 minute walk. The hotel offered price/value. We adored the terrace area overlooking Piazza Sylvestri. We shall return one day as we felt at home from the moment we walked in until we departed. I would advise accepting the Limousine pick up and drop off saving much time from the buses and trains especially if you have a lot of luggage. Ciao! Don and Henry Palm Beach, Florida

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is centrally located, rooms are comfortable and the staff was welcoming and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler94
Reviews.Content: The location, near the Italian Parliament, is central to shopping and historic sites. Rooms, located on the 4th & 5th floor of a downtown building on Via Del Corso, are well appointed. Elevator. Breakfast is served. Staff friendly & versatile in languages. Will schedule transportation to & from airport. My stay felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central position in Rome for everything”
Reviews.Author: ForceTranquille2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in January and were warmly welcomed by Tiziano, who gave us useful directions on the map to visit the tourist sites. He was very helpful regarding my Gluten Free diet, and would have provided my bread if I had informed him. He gave me the address of a restaurant serving Gluten free food in Vatican City called La Soffita, and it was great. There was some noise coming from the room next to ours during the night which kept us awake, but when my husband reported this, we were moved immediately to a quiet room. The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My new "home away from home" in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mjpileggi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Parlamento in October 2010 prior to going on a transatlantic cruise. The last two visits, I stayed at Hotel Giardino (which I like) but this time I wanted to stay in a different locationin Rome. Hotel Parlamanto is in a great location: Close to the Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, and around the corner from via del Corso, the famous shopping street. Just half a block away is a bus station, at piazza San Silvestro. Around the corner from the bus station is a grocery store where we picked up snacks and wine. The hotel has a tiny elevator, so it can take a little time to get people up/down with their luggage. The elevator goes to the 3rd floor and then you have one flight of stairs to the hotel lobby. Next to the lobby/check-in area is a small breakfast room. Our room (#94), one flight up from the lobby level, had a view of the inner courtyard. It was very quiet at night, so I didn’t mind the lack of views. The room was small and a tight fit with our luggage, but we arranged the room so that we could walk around. Twin beds, on the soft side, were comfortable. Lighting was poor but I wasn’t surprised. Most hotels I’ve stayed in while in Europe seem to use low wattage. The room had a flat screen tv., a small table, and end tables next to the beds. The bathroom was a good size with a large counter top space. Lighting could be better but we had a window for light and fresh air. Small shower and bidet. Also on our floor is a doorway to the rooftop terrace. Some of the rooms have direct access to the terrace and pricier than that we paid for our room. This was one area we used during the late afternoon or evenings, enjoying a glass of wine or two, or to simply sit and write in my journal. What I loved the most about Hotel Parlamento was the staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful. One evening the owner, Mr. Chini, treated my cruise friends and me (about a dozen of us) to some red wine and snacks on the terrace. I thought this was a wonderful gesture. The place isn’t fancy but it’s a comfortable place to stay, it’s in a great location and has the best service I’ve found in a long time in my travels. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet rooms and great location in a pricey city.”
Reviews.Author: eskkargo1
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, unobtrusive place tucked into a building very close to the Parliament Building, thus the name. The rooms are ample, clean and unpretentious, the price is right and the location is excellent. It's a short walk to the subway -- about 6 blocks -- and an even shorter walk to a bus plaza that handles what seems like dozens of city lines. The neighborhood is bustling with shops and people, yet the hotel rooms are quiet. You might have to ring for admittance, then cross the interior courtyard to the elevator and it's up 4 floors. (NB -- we stayed here 25 years ago when there was NO elevator. Four flights up and down was nothing to sneeze at!) The breakfast is adequate ---- coffee drinks and tea, juice, fruit, cereal, rolls, biscuits and cheese. If you prefer other offerings, there are cafeterias and restaurants close by. They do have Internet, but charge for it. Many attractions are just a short walk away -- the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona and the aforementioned Spanish Steps. (As for airport connections, they will gladly arrange transport to Fiumicino Airport, but it's cheaper -- and more reliable, what with traffic being so unpredictable -- to take the subway to the main train station and get the Leonardo Express.) We enjoyed our stay and found the staff to be always courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel With Grace and Charm Found In The Center Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: belladonnaLouisiana
Reviews.Content: As you arrive at the Hotel it feels like you are stepping back in time to an era of grace and elegance in a charming hotel with beautiful antiques,a charming terrace,a breakfast room where the smell of espresso is filling the room and warm crossiants are waiting for you,and the rest of the continental breakfast awaits.You feel like lingering over that espresso just alittle longer.Where Filomenia greats you with the biggest smile and makes you feel so special.At the desk the wonderful staff starting with Signor Chini,Tiziano,Andrea,Roberto,Alessandra,and Angelica will help you with whatever you need from reservations,great directions,special things going on in the area,a sense of a protectiveness that was nice for a single person like myself.They are always willing to go that extra mile with a grace and charm you can't find anywhere..The room was always clean and the fresh smelling.There was a towel warmer to warm your towels and the bathrooms clean.I want to especially thank Mr Chini for the special information so I was able to see Pope Benedict on the Via Condotti,you really Rock! Everyone there you know where you stand in my book,all at the top!!! So from the wonderful man that greets you at the entrance during the day,from Tiziano,Andrea,Roberto,Alessandra Mr Chini at the front desk who always make you feel like the most important guest in the world,to Filomenia with that great big smile in the morning to the wonderful clean rooms,and that beautiful terrace alongwith a glass of wine takes you back to a time when Rome took things at a more graceful slower pace,after all nothing worth doing in Rome is ever rushed!So here is a great big thank you to everyone at the hotel,and I mean everyone,for being so kind and gracious.This is for anyone contiplating staying at the hotel,you have made the right choice for your stay in Rome,Mille Grazie Hotel Parlamneto Molto Gentile! When I return to Rome I will defintly stay here and I will tell all my friends too.There are many things I love about Rome,the number1 thing is the Hotel Parlamento!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Parlamento is exactly what you are looking for in a Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jspip
Reviews.Content: I checked the five stars on all the typical barometers used to measure a Hotel; cleanliness, value, rooms, etc. All of those things were excellent at the Hotel Parlamento, but what sets this establishment apart is not as easily measured. Its secret ingredient is the staff, all of whom are very personable and helpful, intent on making your stay in Rome a pleasantly memorable one. From the delightful owner Plinio, to the extremely helpful Tiziano and his brother Andrea, to the darling Angelica, all are sincere and professional in what they do. And what they do is arrange for transportation to and from the airport, make reservations with the galleries and restaurants that require one, help choose a restaurant, call a taxi when needed, all this while engaging in real and helpful conversation (in english) at the same time. And yes, the location is unbeatable. Right from the Hotel you can walk to practically all of the “must see” destinations in Rome, not to mention some fantastic restaurants. The roof terrace, accessible from our room, was wonderful. It’s where we had our cappuccino in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening. I stayed at Hotel Parlamento twice this year, on two different trips to Italy, and when I return to Rome I plan on staying there again. It's just that good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully charming, clean, family- run, centrally- located hotel”
Reviews.Author: carmela-101
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully charming, clean, family-run centrally-located hotel to which we will have no hesitation in returning. The hotel is steps away from the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the metro. Several great restaurants in the area-- the staff made reservations. The staff are professional, kind and courteous. They all speak English very well and are able to give good advice regarding sites, restaurants, shopping etc. This was our home away from home in a magnificent city, Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel and GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: bucsuz
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before a cruise in the MED. Centrally located to ALL the sites. Grocery store close by. Many restaurants and shopping. Very clean. Pleasant and helpful staff. Great VALUE for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live there.”
Reviews.Author: Tomjoad451
Reviews.Content: I believe the first line, the title says it. From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed the Hotel, we felt as though it was our home in Rome. The staff became what felt like family or friends. It was superb. Every breakfast was served with a smile and good coffee with warm rolls. The location was perfect and close to everything Rome has to offer. I will be back, I will stay there again. I must. Ciao Tiziano and Andrea! Pipolo

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful choice!”
Reviews.Author: tartarsbow
Reviews.Content: Once we found the trick of finding the place (there is no marquee outside- but it is clearly labeled with a buzzer) our stay at the hotel was wonderful. The managers and staff went out of their way to help us in everything we needed and were friendly and warm in doing so. the morning cappucino is also delicious! Our room was simple and fine with a bathroom with a bidet and good water pressure. We found it an excellent choice and would return if we went back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, comfortable beds, charming staff”
Reviews.Author: genoise
Reviews.Content: It's not glamorous, but it's very comfortable and convenient to so many tourist spots. Plus the brothers-two (Tiziano and Andrea) are so delightful and helpful. They make you feel like they are there for your needs only. We're fussy about beds and these were excellent. We're even fussier about noise and the double-glazed windows kept the outside noise OUT--even though the hotel is in a busy, noisy shopping area. We would stay here again, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to saty for touring Rome”
Reviews.Author: rdchamberlainpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for 8 nights on our first vacation trip to Rome. Staff was great in helping arrange tours, dinner and transportaion. Location was the best - walked everywhere in the downtown area. Rooms were very clean. Will never forget the quiet glasses of wine on the roof top terrace after a long day of walking the 7 hills of Rome. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: dbarroness
Reviews.Content: our room was a little noisy at night, but we couldn't have been in a better location, everything was in walking distance. the staff was so helpful, including booking a tour of the Vatican for us, which we never would've gotten into without waiting on line for hours. they made great restaurant suggestions with detailed directions and were as nice as can be. rooms were clean and not as small as i thought they'd be. plenty of room for 2. also a terrific outdoor terrace for breakfast. i was extremely happy with our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Italy”
Reviews.Author: debolmstead
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and son-in-law gave us a trip to Italy. We could've gone anywhere but we chose Italy. Our stay at the Hotel Parlamento was wonderful. The hotel was recommended to us by family who had stayed there before. The rooms are charming. The staff was excellent. The hotel is close to everything - Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, The Ruins and wonderful restaurants. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: ST23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in Italy. Booked 5 nights in Rome at Hotel Parlamento based on TripAdvisor reviews. The location is excellent and the two owners, Tiziano and Andrea, are gracious and helpful hosts. Both welcomed us warmly, answered our questions patiently, and helped us navigate Rome. They recommended restaurants based on our interests, and provided 'insider tips' to be sure our sightseeing was a positive experience. The hotel is spotlessly clean. We stayed in room 107, based on TripAdvisor postings, so that we could have direct access to the rooftop courtyard, but do be aware that it is not a private rooftop courtyard...all who stay in the hotel have access, so smokers, early morning breakfast eaters, and late afternoon wine drinkers will be outside your room! We had great weather so kept the window shutters open for fresh air, which did result in Rome mosquitos and Rome noise. Thick paned windows solve these dilemmas well. This hotel is a treasure. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Hotel, Average Appearance”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller161
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Parlamento in July 2010. The hotel is located in a 5 story building in Rome. The lower floor is apartments, the middle floor is another hotel and Hotel Parlamento is on the top couple of floors. It has a small elevator and nice marble stairs. The location of the hotel is perfect!! It is right off of Via del Corso (one of the major streets). Its a minute from the Spanish Steps, 3 minutes to the Trevi Fountian and 5 minutes to the Piazza Novana. It is also the ideal location for shopping all of the major shops are a few blocks over from the hotel. If you're from Canada or the US the decor and "casual, nonchalant" feel of the hotel could be a little shocking at first but just understand that you're in Europe and that is how they roll over there. The rooms are fine, good size, older decor. Tiziano, Roberto and the other front desk and cleaning staff are VERY friendly and helpful. They just mean well. There is a terrace on the top floor that is open 24 hours for everyone to go to. Its gorgeous and you have a lovely few of the city. Very relaxing at night. Internet is not free but cheap to pay for- worth paying. Overall: Very good hotel, clean, and friendly staff, embrace the European life!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: lucybeth5
Reviews.Content: Rome was our first stop for our honeymoon, and Hotel Parlamento was the perfect place to stay at. Unbelievable location, we could walk to anywhere from it, no transportation needed. The brothers who own it were so completely helpful, they let us know what prices we should be spending on things, and gave us plenty of recommendations of where to go, set up our cab from when we were leaving and set the price at what it should be. They were so sweet and the breakfast was perfect. The rooftop terrace was beautiful with beautiful sites!!!! It was just what we needed for our most amazing experience in ROME!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, affordable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen416
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in September 2009, for 2 nights. It was the most affordable hotel we stayed at on our vacation. It is in a safe neighborhood. The room we stayed in was a double with 2 twin beds. It was a small room, with a small bathroom.... but it was sufficient for the time we spent there. It was quiet, and we were able to sleep well at night. A family runs this hotel, and they were very helpful and always gracious. The hotel is within walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. We enjoyed our stay here, and I would definitely stay here again if I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “This is by far the best place to stay in Rome if you are looking for location, price and service.”
Reviews.Author: Rachel330
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for her 16th birthday trip to Rome after an extensive hotel search onliine. This hotel lived up to all the positive reviews it got. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to provide good service. They were an excellent source of information and their directions to sights in and around Rome were perfect, right down to the exact public transportation stops/bus nos. and time to get somewhere. Roof-top terrace room 106 was perfect for two people with ample space for luggage and relaxation. The bathroom with bath and shower, though small by U.S. standards, was more than adequate. Loved being able to open our doors onto the terrace and enjoy the early evening in Rome. At night, with the doors closed, the room was quiet for sleep. Breakfast was a simple continental spread, but the hotel staff went above and beyond by offering it to us on two occasions earlier in the morning when we were heading out before breakfast officially started. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, comfortable, but not extravagant hotel in Rome. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “No better Value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Party013
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 nights at Hotel Parlamento this July- the location is excellent as the reviews state, it REALLY is steps from all the major sights in Rome at an incredible price. The room we stayed in wasn’t luxurious, but more than comfortable for us both. You will see some mixed reviews on this site about the rooms and bathrooms… you have to put things in perspective… when paying 100 euros per night don’t expect 5 star amenities! The bed was a little hard but the hote; including our room, was kept extremely clean. The bathroom was more than big enough with a Jacuzzi bath and shower, toilet, bidet and sink. It was a comfortable place to stay after long days walking through the city. Breakfast was good but without much variety… but again considering the price and the location (who cares!!!!) ; The hotel staff are wonderful. They were friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable, offering tips that made our wonderful vacation in Rome even more pleasant. A special thanks to Tiziano who always went the extra mile! Air conditioning was an extra 12 Euros per day was necessary as the hotel is on the 4th floor so there’s no escaping the direct sun; Our room opened on to the lovely rooftop terrace which is ideal for a late day glass of wine, breakfast or for a bit of quiet time- so, when you reserve ask for this room! We highly recommend Hotel Parlamento and should we return to Rome, this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: italiangirl28
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value! From this hotel, all major sites are in walking distance. We never needed a cab! Hotel Parlamento is very clean and the staff is welcoming and very helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel Parlamento”
Reviews.Author: c_and_g_canada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 9 nights at Hotel Parlamento. We found the hotel through TripAdvisor and through a travel guide. While location seemed excellent, we were a little nervous about what we might find especially given the reasonable room rates. Our worries were unfounded. The room we stayed in was not huge, but plenty big enough for the bed and to move around. The bathroom was very nicely done, including a small Jacuzzi shower. The sliding door between bathroom and room was a little challenging to close. The hotel, including our room, was kept extremely clean. It was a comfortable place to stay after long days walking through the city. Breakfast was good but without variety; after 9 days we were ready for a change. Then again, it was included with the room. The hotel staff are magnificent. They were friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable, offering tips that made our wonderful vacation in Rome even more pleasant. We already miss them! Air conditioning was an extra 12 Euros per day and there is a fee for high speed internet but given the inexpensive base rate it is still a deal especially given the prime location. The hotel is on the 4th floor; be prepared for stairs or you can take the small, but nice elevator to the landing right below the reception. A small room bar fridge would be the one amenity we would have liked. Take advantage of the lovely terrace for late day glass of wine, breakfast or for a bit of quiet time. We were fortunate to have a room that opened directly to the terrace. We recommend Hotel Parlamento to our friends and family. Should we return to Rome, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time at This Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcreese
Reviews.Content: We keep returning to the Parlamento for many reasons. The location is wonderful, the staff is friendly, helpful and very professional and the value is superb. The three rooms we have stayed in were moderate in size and very well arranged. The bathrooms were very nice and everything was very clean. The rooftop terrace was a great outdoor space to read or have a glass of wine. We will continue to return to the Parlamento when we visit Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CorinneSouthbury_CT
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, good security, and a great staff. Otherwise, I would say that it is an average hotel. We were in Room 96 which has a kingsize bed (2 beds pushed together, but very comfortable). The pillows were thin. The room was small but adequate. The bathroom was not great. The biggest problem was the shower head. It was not a handheld shower and because the shower stall was about 30 inches by 30 inches, when the shower was on, it filled the whole shower stall. To shower we had to shut off the water and soap up and then turn the water on to rinse. I think if they replaced the shower head, it would be a huge improvement. The bathroom was a little dark and it was hard to see when putting on makeup or inserting contact lenses.. There was one plug in the entire room- near the sink. When you turn off the bathroom light the plug does not work, so you can't charge your electronics unless you leave the light on. This hotel was the only hotel we stayed at that did not have free Wi-Fi. It was actually sort of nice not to be connected, so I am not sure that is a negative. IF you really need the Wi-Fi or internet point, there was a nominal charge. Breakfast was so-so but adequate enough to fill us up until lunch. The staff was more than accomodating and they made the place.. The location could not be better. We were able to walk to the Spanish step and the Trevi Fountain in the evening. Don't mis them after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Look no more...Hotel Parlamento is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dnbleavenworth
Reviews.Content: Location...best location in Rome. Walking distance to most sights, restaurants, shopping, banks etc. There is a large bus station just down the street and right across the street there was pizza and gelato available. Staff...very friendly and helpful.. especially Tiziano. They all made you feel welcome. Tiziano went out of his way to help arrange tours and transportation for us. Even arranged our transportation from the port to the airport after our cruise 10 days after we checked out. Whenever we had questions someone was always there ready and willing with answers. Hotel...the roof top terrace was wonderful. It was a pleasant escape for breakfast, a glass of wine or just read a book. Rooms were on the small side (normal for Rome) but clean and comfy. A special touch to the continental breakfast was the cappuccino. At the Hotel Parlamanto they made you feel welcomed as well as safe and secure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: joymama
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parlamento was wonderful. It is everything that we needed in Rome. When in Rome, location is key if you want to see all of the sights, and walk to most of them as well. This is the place to stay for those reasons. The staff is unbelievably helpful and courteous and are there for all of your needs. This is not a luxury hotel, but it is clean, well organized, and the small breakfast in the morning, is truly all you need. The hotel is safe and secure, and quite lovely to say the least. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very average pension”
Reviews.Author: sammymalagaspain
Reviews.Content: Central to all tourist places, easy walk to Spanish steps and trevi etc, very plain no frills, entrance via elevator from street as on 4th floor. near plenty of restaurants. No parking, double windows to keep out street noise very good, poor wardrobe space, tiny room and the smallest shower I have ever seen -hardly able to close the folding door, sliding door to bathroom stuck, staff very helpful, euros 3 to use computer, at euros 150 a night well overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TLWestLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel Parlamento in the "heart of Rome" and were impressed with the warm welcome from Tiziano and all of the staff. The room was a good size, the breakfast (juice, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, assorted bread basket and jams, excellent coffee with heated milk) was a great start to walking to all the sites closeby (Trevi, Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Victor Emanuel, St. Peter's, Capitoline Museum, Forum). We would highly recommend this hotel, and plan to return ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: scootertrav
Reviews.Content: A quaint little hotel within a larger apt house. This is a great little hotel. Very kind and helpful staff. Great breakfast in the morning. Bread, yogurt, biscuits, juice and coffee. Clean room, bathroom, Satellite tv. Great location. Near everything, subaway and especially a big bus stop where a lot of routes come through. You walk to Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, Spanish Step within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Rome. THe hotel staff were as helpful as could be. I am staying there next year.”
Reviews.Author: abigale33
Reviews.Content: I have been to Rome more than 36 times and I could not praise this hotel any higher It is in the best location, The breakfast was great. the room was like a studio apt. I look forward to staying there next year. Vito Alesi

Reviews.Title: “Great hosts and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianPJ
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 24 year old daughter and I stayed here for five nights, enroute to a wedding elsewhere in Italy. The hotel is so well situated that we only ever took one taxi--walked to the Vatican, four times to Trevi Fountain, to the Colosseum, etc.. The hosts were more than helpful with suggestions, directions, maps and always cheerful and upbeat. Our room slept three, in basic comfort but after all that daily walking, getting to sleep was never an issue! Breakfast outside on the sunny roof top patio was a real treat ('though breakfast was rather repetitive after five mornings). The teeny-tiny elevator to the street level was always great fun--you'll know when you try it out with three adults!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, exceptional service, all in the heart of Rome. Kudos!”
Reviews.Author: Special_K_n_Marj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days at the beginning of our month in Italy and highly recommend it. While reading these reviews I experienced "deja vu" and a pleasant nostalgic tingle up my spine and realized I was wearing a broad smile. Many pleasant memories! Everything about this hotel is first class if somewhat modest. Nothing over the top here in luxury but you will be treated like a millionaire and will want to return, as we will soon. I won't repeat what the others have written but rest assured the positive reviews are true and you will love it here. Caveat: European hotels can be compact and sometimes cramped compared to what we're used to in North America. Although not exactly spacious we never felt cramped. That is the worst thing I can say about the Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: noamaye
Reviews.Content: This was a great , small hotel and I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Great staff, great breakfast, and excellent location. This was my first trip to Rome and everything was at my fingertips. The rooftop was a nice break for a drink before dinner our our room was perfect and clean with a full bath. My only complaint was that our room was right off the main entrance, so we had a bit of noise in the morning, but as I discovered after traveling through Italy, walls are generally thin, so this really wasn't a big deal. I don't know what makes a hotel a 2-star or 3-star, or what gets them into the various guide books, but for me, Hotel Parlamento was definitely a 3-star and should be listed in Frommer's! The next time I go to Rome, I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “look no further...”
Reviews.Author: captbrad617
Reviews.Content: selected Parlamento after extensive online and guidebook [re]search. central location, price and the FABULOUS terrace - now 'our' terrace - main INITIAL criteria for me. Awesome staff, [our now] family of owner Senore Plinio [Pliny] far exceeded many and most hotel 'service' - ANYwhere. Used hotels pickup service [E55] well worth it luxury to have someone waiting past baggage for just YOU in big van, easy no stress ride to [initially] hard to find - [ Via CON-VER-titte not Via CON-DOTTI]. Extra E20 got nice, easy drive, non stop arrival tour [hwy #8] by Ostia, St John's, porta St Paolo, Collosseum, Forum, hotel. The 3 terrace rooms are IT. Terrace available to all guests. [KILLER for 2-3 couples, family or sm group] We in #104 w/ 3 single beds, yes, tight but -WORKED. REALLY comfy mattresses and thick covers [get extra pillows] all very clean; [WHY do the complainers dare mention 'small'?] modern, marble bath [is YOURS?] - VERY acceptable, lotsa high pressure hot H2O [3 ina row!]. w/ 120V outlets included. FAT towels. #104 has window for air circulation, relatively quiet for Roma, [no bars nearby!] to walk out french doors onto flowered terrace for, I think, EXCELLENT no effort breakfast served by smiling bella Angelina in our 'jammies, glass of wine in early eve, late nite reflection/unwind over tiled rooftops - and perfect for the smokers, all most convenient and fantasy fantastic. Bought picture perfect bananas and strawberries etc for AM + PM at adjacent stands. food supermarket, pharmacy, boutiques, bookstore, post OFFICE, street vendors[be Roman,get scarfs!] within block+ for picnics,early shopping etc. If your the type,as me for easy, early sightsee walks before breakfast, [which ends at humane 10:30, pui o meno] Confirm excellent coffees [hoo-ray!] n fine crossiants [complainers stay in France!] and 2 REAL fruit juices-[MY heaven!] [all you can eat/drink]. nice fruit cocktail [OK complainers-canned!] Yogurt, 3 cereals,1 a granola, quality jams,honey teas and decadent Nutella complete the lovely, immaculate AM offering and service. [Those who are Complainers can drink hemlock and DIE] [snitched the perfect bread rolls for meat, cheese and olive picnic in Ostia] All expectations WAY exceeded, All previous [positive!] reviews confirmed - all others tiny pointless nitpicks really ['free' web junkies stay home in your bedroom]- people! - this is ROMA, in ITALY in EUROPE - get IT or don't ! most of us do not fly, travel -or live- First Class, but this a high value, high quality and 'classy' act by justly proud owner operated HOTELIERS - [if ONLY 3nd class to the travel snobs] - do better if you can find it, or afford it.- in the TOTAL sum total, I seriously doubt it can be done. returning to Italy [army brats as children] with my 2 sisters[1 Italy born] as tourists and to visit family [Verona]. THEOFFICIAL tourist info nearby, on Via Corso, very helpful [in english] info and reservation service. Roma pass highly recommended, saved $, skipped many LOOONG lines, unlimited transport pass etc., BIG money/time saver. Big bus junction /taxi stand adjacent @Plaza San Silvestro. easy to figure bus system. Main N-S Via Corso- 15 ft! - w/ pass, buses hop on/off big feet saver too,even short hops- 15 min walk =5 min bus! great for those who accompany 'Pokey' or are fast movers..'OPEN" trolley stop #13 @ 4 blocks. short cheap taxi home at night, just say: 'Plaza San Silvestro' Very nice to stroll in eve after full days to very close Trevi-Steps-Navona-Pantheon. [later in eve day jammed trevi near deserted] multiple delicious, day/nite lanquid visits each -WOW!.no need to 'schedule'. Everywhere [EX Vatican] easy walk. Hidden gem of Ostia Antica wonderful Pompeii alternative day trip for we ancient ruin/history affictionados. [Metro/train included in roma pass, gave free Ostia entrance-intentional?usual?- instead of discount on our used passes= BIG +save!] They reccomended 'MACHARONIES' -?sp- for cheap,luxury,busy local client trattoria restaurant, which we returned to several times cause we liked it, were the only 'tourists' there, and they heartily welcomed us like lost family - how nice! so much more to tell ya....BUT NUFF SAID!

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: christophbeeler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited along with 4 of our friends for two nights. The hotel itself was clean and was within walking distance to all of the major attractions. The best part of this hotel is the staff. They are very friendly, and gave us alot of valuable information such as where to buy tickets to places to avoid long lines. They saved us hours of standing in lines with their tips and advice. In a very expensive city, they were a real bargain! The owner made went out of his way to let us know how much he valued our business and was as friendly as can be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location and fantastic and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1493
Reviews.Content: Our six day vacation to Rome was wonderful due to the lovely Hotel Parlamento. The location was superb, right in the center of Rome....a few minutes walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. From the moment we entered the hotel the staff was warm and helpful. The room we had #104 had a fantastic roof top balcony with flowers and furniture so that we could sit outside and enjoy the rooftops of Rome.. The room was immaculate and cleaned each day with fresh towels. Every morning after breakfast Tiziano, the owner would sit with us and help us plan that days touring.
