He was our in-house tour guide with all the good tips to enhance our days touring. I would highly recomend Hotel Parlamento to anyone visitng Rome...It is a gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Parlamento made our shourt break great”
Reviews.Author: Marchrisilyn
Reviews.Content: Although small, Hotel Parlamento was very friendly with a warm atmosphere and very warm rooms. The staff made us very welcome, gave us great recommendations for local restaurants and pointed out all the must do’s whilst we were there (all pointed out on their complementary map). The location was spot on for all the attractions and we really did not need our 3 day Roma passes as all the must see attractions were within walking distance. The only thing that I could criticise was the weather, which could have been a little dryer, but I can’t blame that on the hotel. A great budget hotel I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, superbly friendly, family run central hotel”
Reviews.Author: djburns
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely 2 star hotel in a fantastic central location for all of Rome's wonderful historic sites. It is close to Spagna Metro station which is a pleasant stroll around the corner past the Spanish steps. As mentioned in previous reviews the staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. They were helpful & polite without being intrusive. The room we stayed in was not large but adequate for our needs as was the en-suite bathroom. The room bordered the road but with the shutters, double layer of double glazing and thick curtains any road noise was eliminated and we slept well every night. It being a rather wet January weekend we did not try the lovely looking roof terrace. My only slight disappointment was the breakfast which consisted of cereals, juice, bread rolls, prepacked biscuits & toast and coffee. Some ham, cheese and fresh fruit would have been very welcome. This is only a minor quibble though and I would certainly stay in the Hotel Parlamento on another visit to Rome and would also recommend it to others. Tip: Bus 116 stops right outside and can take you to the Pantheon & Campo Fiori if you don't feel like walking.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel to choose in Roma”
Reviews.Author: ViaggioItaliano9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Rome a number of times; the last three visits we stayed at this wonderful hotel. It is family owned; the owners and all the people who work here are friendly, helpful and a delight to interact with. The last time we stayed here, in September 2009, we were in a room with double doors to the rooftop garden -- what a delight! This hotel is convenient and walking distance to almost everything you would want to see in Rome - the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navonna, Coliseum and ruins, Pantheon. The Vatican is a bit farther walk, to the west, but we walked almost every time. And the neighborhood is good - we enjoyed eating dinner outdoors and walking back to the hotel. On our second and third trips (perhaps because we told them we were repeat visitors) they greeted us with fruit and a bottle of wine in our room. The hotel is just across Via del Corso from the Italian Parliament, the seat of government, so the area is well patrolled by police. You can use the hotel computer with internet access. This is the ONLY place we will stay in Rome - I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to say goodbye to Rome and the Hotel Parlamento”
Reviews.Author: melisadb
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has visited Rome knows that there is lots to see/do so location is a must. I made reservations on the advise of a friend who stays at the Hotel Parlamento now on every visit to Rome. What I discovered was a lovely quaint hotel hidden in the heart of all the most important tourists attractions. Almost everything is within walking distance or a very short cab/bus ride. I also discovered a 24 hr staff (always there to help) comprised of mostly family members who should pride themselves on the personal service they offer each guest. Besides old world charm and competitive room rates, the staff is fluent in many languages and is very knowledgeable on places to go, how to get there and times of operation, Each morning one will begin their day with a continental breakfast which is available until 10am for us not so early risers. From there the staff is ready to offer everything from the current weather conditions to available tours and must see happenings in and around the city. If you are looking for a small, lovely, clean, safe, very professionally run family Hotel in the heart of the city I recommend Hotel Parlamento. I was completely happy with my decission to stay at this hotel and honored to meet the Owner, his family and wonderful employees who helped make my stay one I will never forget..... I will return to Rome City and to the Hotel Parlimento. Sincerely, Melisa Barnett

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite Hotel In The Heart Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: belladonnaLouisiana
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for 2 weeks.It was my 6th trip back to Rome.I have stayed in alot of hotels in Euorpe,and this hotel was a class act from the moment we arrived till the day we left,the rooms were spotless,the breakfast room was charming,alongwith the quiet terrace,were a glass of wine would be perfect!They have an awesome wine selection for sale.Alongwith other drinks for sale.The breakfast is a charming continental breakfast,with wonderful croissants,and rolls,a fruit salad,and the best espresso in town,not to mention the capuccino!The front desk staff were the kindest we have meet in a very long time.From Mr Chini,Tiziano,Andrea,Angelica,Roberto and Alessandra.Each one made sure that everything was the best for my friend and I,I too felt like family!You know you can go to alot of hotels,where all they think about is getting the most people in,and so many bells and whistles they forget to care about the people,here it was a different story,they truely know how to care about the the person and make you feel so welcome and special,and have nice things like the internet access(for a nominal fee),private bathrooms(some have tubs but most have showers,that are along the lines of european showers).I stayed in room 78,and had plenty of room for one person.I will treasure my stay at the Hotel Parlamento,just as much as the Trevi Fountain that is only 2 blocks away.They can help plan tours for you,give great directions,and recomend awesome resturants,and at this hotel someone is always at the hotel 24/7.Thank you to everyone at the hotel for making my stay so very special,I will return soon and I will be spending it at the Hotel Parlamento.If you want a quiant hotel with alot of charm then this is the hotel for you.If you have any questions about Italy feel free to email me at [--]. The Hotel Parlamento is the best thing about Rome,a nice tranquil place in the busy city of Rome.Just remember it is near Piazza San Silvestro,blocks from the Spanish Steps,Pantheon,Trevi fouintain,and not too far from the Colosieum.You will find the joy everyone else has found about this hotel,just remeber to tell them Karen sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MorkMindy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 15 nights at the Hotel Parlamento during the last two weeks of October. We walked absolutely every where from this great location in the heart of Rome. 5 minutes to Trevi, 7 minutes to Piazza Navona with Campo De Fiore just two beyond that. The Spanish Steps five minutes in the other direction and the best shopping in the world. Our room, on the street side of the hotel off of the patio, was always well made up and reasonably quiet so long as the double windows were closed. Yes, the shower is small but this is Europe so get used to it. The hotel staff is great and will do everything possible to make your stay as easy as possible. However, they are not tour guides so don't expect that level of service. The continental breakfast is probably a 20 Euro value and comes with freshly baked bread and the consistently best coffee I have ever had. They have white & red wines available for you to purchase at the front desk and enjoy on the roof top patio. I suggest you do this. All in all this was an excellent value and I doubt that you can find an equivalent for anywhere near the 155 Euro per night that we paid. Make your reservations early as the Parlamento is quickly becoming the go to place in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “My 6th stay at Parlamento - like visiting old friends & family!”
Reviews.Author: GlobusWorldTrav
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my 9th trip to Rome in the last 12 years, and the last 6 of those trips I've stayed at Hotel Parlamento. I originally found it listed in an issue of National Geo Traveler in the early 2000's when they did an article called "The Top 10 hotels in Rome for under $135 a night" and I just kept coming back. It's mostly a family-run pensione, and if you stay for a few days you'll get to know everyone that works the desk. I feel like they've become real-life friends over my many stays there, and part of the fun of returning to Rome time after time is knowing that I have people to re-connect with when I'm there. The last couple visits, I went with my partner... since we're both guys, I wasn't sure what the reaction would be upon our arrival -- we've experienced some unpleasantness from hotels in the past, based on peoples' personal discriminatory attitudes -- but just as I expected, they greeted him with open arms. They're good people, and they're truly a class act. About the hotel itself: the construction is finished, and the lift has been extended so it reaches all the way to the ground floor. But honestly, I've thought some of the past reviews were absolutely silly for mentioning that you had to walk up a half-flight of stairs to get to the lift, or that they were bothered by the construction, when no noise ever reached the hotel and no construction ever blocked entry. I never understood why some of the reviewers got so bothered by these things, when they hardly impeded your travel or your access to the hotel. But alas, I guess some people are just hard to please. The rooms aren't the sprawling, suite-like Holiday Inn-type rooms that many Americans are used to, they're European-sized, which means that they're on the smaller side. They're very clean, have air conditioning (if you request it), and the bathrooms are all new & marble. One of the best features of this hotel is its location: it sits right at Piazza San Silvestro, which is practically "dead center" of the city of Rome, and especially to the areas that you'll want to be exploring. San Silvestro is also the hub for all of the buses, and there is a taxi stand there as well. You are 10 short minutes' walk to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, Piazza del Popolo; all of the shops that line the Corso and the very inviting sidestreets are at your feet, including the Galleria di Alberto Sordi, which is something like a mall containing a handful of stores in a gorgeous old building. So if your day should get rained out, you have plenty of indoor options (including the Doria Pamphilj museum) very close by. And at the end of the day, you can sit on the hotel's rooftop terrace with a glass of wine, and take in the sights below you: the buzz from the Corso, the people strolling through Piazza San Silvestro... it's a lovely way to unwind. You can also take your breakfast up there, AND there are 2 or 3 rooms that open right onto the terrace as well. We stayed in 104 which was very cute, and we loved being able to open the doors right onto the terrace! If you need help with reservations or scheduling, they'll happily help you. And if you're a seasoned traveler and you want some inside tips -- places off the beaten path, non-touristy areas, neighborhoods that are great for walking or exploring, or even just a place to take in a romantic walk and a sunset -- these are the guys to ask! I've sent about 10 different friends to Parlamento over the last few years -- a single friend, a family of 4, another gay couple, a group of girlfriends traveling together -- and they've all loved Hotel Parlamento and thanked me profusely for recommending it. A hotel in this location normally runs a gazillion dollars a night, and this is part of the reason why Parlamento is such a great find: it's reasonably priced, and it's a lovely little hotel. I'd suggest taking a look at the other reviewers' posted photos if you want to get an idea of what the rooms look like. They're furnished very simply and with some antiques, and I believe that all of the rooms have now been updated to include flat-screen TVs (ours had one). Also, extra bonus: the hotel now has wi-fi! If you don't have a laptop, they also have a computer in the lobby/breakfast area. You need to buy a card w/a password to access the wi-fi (10E for 6 hours of 5E for 2 hours) -- not because the hotel is greedy or anything, but because of the Internet protection laws in Italy, which seem to be quite strict. So alas, no free wi-fi... but certainly not through any fault of theirs! And if you're a traveler who's new to Rome, can I make one recommendation? Take the winding sidestreets, let yourself get a little bit lost, and enjoy the experience. See more of the city than just the Vatican and the Coliseum: go to Trastevere & other neighborhoods and wander the ancient streets, and take some time to soak up what this city is all about. Spend an hour lingering over a cup of coffee or a cocktail, and people-watch. Take in the morning market at Campo de'Fiore or at Bar Farnese. Find an out-of-the-way hole-in-the-wall restaurant on a crowd-free sidestreet and enjoy a quiet dinner. Take a late-night walk down quiet cobblestoned streets. Rome is a beautiful place with a lot to discover: and Parlamento is a great home-base to have while you explore it. They are like my Roman cousins, and I adore them, which is why I keep going back time after time. Thanks Plinio, Andrea, Tiziano, Roberto & Angelica for another lovely stay. Ci vediamo a presto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, comfortable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tudomany
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in the old part of Rome within walking distance of many of the sights we wanted to see (the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps). There are also a number of stores, restaurants, and money changes in the area, as well as a major bus hub and a post office. It is not far from the river. The staff speaks English and is very helpful. A fairly substantial breakfast buffet was served on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel for its great location, helpful staff and reasonable prices!!”
Reviews.Author: Diana09California
Reviews.Content: In ;late September I stayed at the Hotel Parlamento on two difference occasions. I was visiting Rome before leaving on a cruise, so I stayed two nights before leaving on the cruise and one night after returning. The location is great--just five minutes from the Trevi Fountain, and about ten minutes from the Spanish steps. The staff was very friendly and most helpful to me. This was my first trip to Rome, and they answered all my questions. They also helped me with directions to wherever i wanted to go, and they called a cab for me each time I had to return to the train station. Also, maybe best of all, their prices are very reasonable, for comfortable, clean rooms, and the price includes breakfast. When I next return to Rome, I hope that I can stay at the Hotel Parlamento again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: R_and_D_NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights before joining a tour. I don't understand the Italian star system, this supposed 2 star hotel was superior to the 4 star hotel that was part of the tour. I think the Parlamento only gets 2 stars because you have to go up about a dozen steps from the small lift - but what else do you expect in a building that is 5 centuries old. The room is smallish, normal for european, quiet and clean. The bathroom was very good. There was a roof garden that was lovely for a drink & relax at the end of the day sightseeing & before dinner. All the staff had excellent english, and were knoweldgeable and helpful. Good range of foods at breakfast. The hotel is an excellent location, midway between the Trevi fountain and the Spanish Steps. We were able to walk everywhere, all the attractions, a good range of restaurants, the supermarket (for snacks and wine to enjoy on the roof garden) and the laundromat. We relied on reviews from TripAdvisor to choose this hotel, & it lived up to our expectations

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: donato08
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Hotel Parlamento and we can't say enough about it. The location is great, close to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Pizza Navona, Trevi Fountain and many other historical sites. The staff is just great, friendly and very helpful, they make you feel like family. Don and Pam Dexter, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: RestingEngland
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Rome. 3 of us flew Easy jet from UK - excellent. Taxi pick up at Rome Fiumcino Airport (Rome Shuttle) - didn't show. Picked up white taxi at the airport at 2130 for cost of 45 euros. Not necessary to book next time. Hotel Parlamento (2 star) is situated right in the centre of Rome equi-distant from Trevi, Spanish Steps, Pantheon. The Bus Station on the square , designer shops and Parliaament buildings and Post Office are just adjacent. Wise to book room 106 which has french windows to the roof terrace outside your room.. Breakfast on the terrace at no extra charge is OK but not great. Rooms have TV, safe, clean and even a jacuzzi type bath - room bit faded but clean. The staff are courteous, helpful and will help with maps, transport, advice and shopping. This part of Rome is totally safe and secure, day and night, suited politicians and smart businesspeople abound. Lots of inexpensive eating places are very close and the Pizza Restaurant (turn left as you come out of the hotel) up the street to has the traditional open fire oven. The famous ice cream parlour , about 100/150 yards up from the trevi, that's with the trevi on your left straight up the street facing you and take the first left, it's tiny, no seats BUT ICE CREAM TO DIE FOR. Try to see the Trevi at night. Went to the flower market which was just two or three stalls selling flowers but the other stalls were interesting, selling fruit and veg, cheese and some tat. Not really worth a detour. The round-Rome open deck bus is excellent value, you can get off and on when you like and takes in all the sites. Must not miss the Sistine Chapel and the Vatican and the Bergaze Museum which you have to book a slot in advance - the hotel will do that for you but the tip is to book in advance of you getting to Rome. The Pantheon is astonishing and need to walk there. Another tip, the hotel is nearly always booked up so you need to book well in advance, before you book your flight cos it is very popular - partly the price and the location. There is a lift at the hotel but it does not go the whole way, there is a small flight of stairs before you reach the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming plus Location”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl52
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Parlamento was one of the highlights of our vacation in Italy. The location near a bus station was excellent and walks to great restaurants were never too far. The room was standard Rome complete with a small bathroom, but it was also exceedingly clean. Since we never spend much time in the room, clean is all we need. The beds looked like they might be uncomfortable, but were actually the most comfortable of the 4 hotels we stayed in. Breakfast on the rooftop was quite good. But more than that was the helpful staff! There was no question or request that was too much trouble. Each time we returned to our room we were greeted with a warm welcome. We would all stay here again and feel like we were coming home!

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...stay at the Hotel Parlamento!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn_in_Edmonds
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, we stayed for 3 days at the start of our 16 day Italian adventure. Hotel is very well situated, walking distance to many sites. Room was nice, and the A/C extremely worth the extra charge! Hotel staff, especially Andrea, were very professional, nice and informative. The cappucino's at breakfast were wonderful! Also really enjoyed meeting new friends over a bottle of wine at the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duckpipe
Reviews.Content: Great desk staff. Very helpfull. and breakfast and room staff attentive to your needs. Well worth a revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lmgaff
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Parlamento. Location was excellent and rooftop terrace perfect for breakfast or a drink. Room was quiet, clean, small but perfectly adequate. Staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: mmao
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific (which is very important in Rome) however the rooms are tiny and the bathrooms are even smaller (best suited to contortionists). The rooms were pretty tired and needed refurbishing. The service was so-so. One morning the water supply was cut off (not the hotel's fault, as the whole block had no water). Rather than apologising and procuring some water for tea/coffee, the receptionist just blamed the water board! So if location is everything to you and you are not very tall or big (the rooms are best suited to people under 175 cms) then stay at the Parlemento.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful Hosts”
Reviews.Author: TonyinCT
Reviews.Content: Visited Rome in August with my wife and two daughters, and we found the Hotel Parlamento to be perfectly suited to our needs. They converted a large double room into a quad, which included 3 beds, a private bath, plenty of closet space, a TV, and a safe. It was a great value. Breakfast was included. We paid a small charge for Internet access and air conditioning -- well worth it. Comfortable, modest in appearance, it is a delightful place to stay.The best things about the hotel are its excellent location, wonderful hospitality, and cozy rooftop terrace. The hotel is just a short walk from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, Piazza Navonna, and other sights. For evening strolls (passeggiate) through some of Rome's most beautiful areas, this hotel is perfectly situated. It's easy to get anywhere from here. A few blocks down the street from the hotel is a Traveler's Information Center where you can buy a "Roma Pass" for discounts on museum admissions and subway fare. The staff will gladly give you a map and show you the best ways to get around Rome. After a day of sightseeing, you can relax on the rooftop terrace. Either buy a bottle of wine or a cold beer from the hotel, or bring a bottle of your own to enjoy. (They'll lend you a corkscrew.) In fact, if you need anything -- restaurant recommendations, travel advice, a glass of orange juice, or whatever -- don't hesitate to politely ask. Everyone speaks English, and they'll make every effort to help you. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff, Clean Rooms, Excellent location, will go back soon.”
Reviews.Author: Makhzoumi
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at HP on our way to Venice and I had to book one day before the trip (as usual!!!) i found this hotel on tripadvisor and called!, Andrea answered the phone and since then our stay in Room was fabulous, he booked us 2 rooms, arranged for airport pickup and gave us the best rates and showed us were to go sightseeing! the hotel location was EXCELLENT, a walking distance from mostly everywhere we wanted to visit in the 2 days. Andrea also helped us get back to the hotel when we got lost in the city ( I called him like 6 times in the first evening!!). we had 2 rooms and they were very clean and rearranged next day, the Safe was something I appreciated along the conditioning, the breakfast was good and the other satff were very friendly. Thanks Andrea and thanks HP.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain rates with 5-star customer service”
Reviews.Author: KatGoesBananas
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's true - the rooms are teensy, but ours was clean, well-laid out, and completely met our needs. What makes this hotel a fantastic value is the staff - what lovely, friendly people! We took advantage of their car service from the airport - highly recommended. We felt like real VIPs as we whizzed by the obscene taxi line in our private Mercedes. All-in-all, we were 100% happy that we saved so much money by choosing this hotel in lieu of one of the many pricier options in Rome. And we were delighted to have air conditioning at the end of a hot day touring Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: sinjin23
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here. Found bed bugs in my room. Had bites all over my body. It ruined my trip. I had to get new clothes, luggage etc.

Reviews.Title: “Our new base when in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: mebig
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our vacation and the best part of it was Rome, not only because Rome is such a wonderful place, but also because of the great luck we had with our hotel selection and all of the great staff there. We can't express our gratitude enough to the staff of the Hotel Parlamento, starting with the doorman and his lovely wife, Andrea, Tiziano, Roberto, Paolo and everybody else (sorry if we missed anyone). They were all key in making this vacation such a memorable one. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. The room was so adorable and clinically clean. We can only say that we got extremely lucky! Our son, who is very picky when staying away from home, enjoyed every second in this hotel. Don't look any further, we would strongly recommend this hotel to everyone of all ages. Definitely our new base in Rome! Looking forward to seeing the pleasant staff again in the near future. We would also like to take this opportunity to thank everyone at the Hotel Palamento for their wonderful hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nemahbin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location to access the city for sightseeing. Everything was very clean, breakfast adequate. The staff was attentive and helpful. I would not recomment the "loft" type room we had on the top floor - noisy with sea gulls all night, but no street noise - low ceiling that we had to be careful not to hit our head in the bedroom area. The bathroom was gorgeous with marble all over. There was no mold, just the shower is made for someone 5 ft. tall or less. I would return to this hotel, just ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, but nothing to get excited about.”
Reviews.Author: CarrierofthePitcher
Reviews.Content: After staying in some nicer hotels, we were initially rather disappointed with our hotel room. However, after our first night we came to truly appreciate the location, the in-room AC, the people who work there (who are all very kind and helpful), etc. The hotel's shortfalls are the size of our room was no bigger than a postage stamp, they don't have an iron to borrow, the doors are so thin that if someone is out in the hall in the middle you would think they were talking right to your face, the hotel is in need of an update, the shower drains really slowly and is TINY!!!, etc. Also, you have to pay for internet access. They had a nice roof top terrace, but it was too hot to take advantage of it. Also, the breakfast is decent, but consists mostly of rolls, coffee or tea, yogurt, and cereal. But like I mentioned, the people that work there are nice and helpful and the location is great for getting to many of the major sites in Rome. And the price is good when you consider other places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable excellence with personable service”
Reviews.Author: ParkerOregon
Reviews.Content: The Parlamento is a gold mine. Between delicious coffee and croissants in the morning, to happy hour on the beautiful quaint patio, my most treasured memories of Italy were shared between the conversations that my brother, dad and I shared with Andrea. Andrea, the concierge, not only helped us by providing location information to sightsee Rome, but also made our stay move from good to stellar because of his humble hospitality. The Parlamento also made my stay in Rome superb because it was within walking distance of all the major sights. Thank you Andrea, and Hotel Parlamento for making my stay in Rome so amazing.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to keep the Hotel Parlamento my little secret.”
Reviews.Author: Professor26
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Parlamento was such an excellent find. Tucked away in the midst of Rome, I felt as if I lived in the city, and was heading to my own room when I would go back to the Hotel after a day/night of Roming about the city. The Staff, especially Roberto and Angelica, were kind, patient, and helpful: directions, phrases, restaurant recommendations. Excellent. Rooms were clean. Breakfast was abundant with many choices. And a bottle of Brunello on the roof deck in the evening with friends was an added bonus. I am hopeful that I can stay at the Hotel Parlamento in all of my future trips to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “People nice, hotel strange but okay”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelTennessee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for 2 nights in June. We had 2 rooms. It was a hard place to find at first since it is on the 3rd and 4th floors of a building. It was a strange set up with the maze of rooms off of small hallways and little light or air from the outside. I was a bit claustrophobic at first but did get used to it. There are 1 or 2 rooms that open to the rooftop patio and that would be the best place to be. The staff was helpful and courteous. The breakfast was okay- mostly cereal and rolls, good cappuchino., but a very small area in which to eat and service on the rooftop was very slow as there was only one person taking care of the drink orders. It was a good location for getting around Rome, and felt very safe. The air conditioning is a must for the summer and worked well. The bathrooms are very small but adequate. Overall, an okay place for the money, especially for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Sooner7
Reviews.Content: if you want to experience the way service used to be stay here. the family that runs it will do almost anything to help you and make your stay a good one. The location is great, the rooms clean and the rooftop terrace a good way to start the day. there is a grocery store about 3 minutes walk away which can be improtant too. The nephew lived in the states for awhile and if he has time will enjoy visiting with you about his experience. it is where our family will stay when not in Oklahoma and in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: illini_girl01
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location with good staff and nice rooms. Tiziano, Andrea, and others went out of their way in helping to arrange our Vatican tickets, a private tour guide, a ride from the airport, etc. We had a great experience in Rome, much do to the assistance we were given along the way!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service, attention to detail, cleanliness, friendliness all top notch!”
Reviews.Author: raydvm
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Hotel Palamento was fantastic! Our family had such a great time in Rome, made possible mostly b/c of the wonderful folks at Parlamento. We experienced airport luggage issues, and all of the concierge were great to enable us to get it back as quickly as possible. Tiziano, Roberto, Andrea, and Allesandra were top notch and first class all the way. We can't thank them enough. Rest assured, we will reserve Parlamento on our next trip to Rome. We want to thank the remaining staff, as well as the hotel owner for their extra kindness and consideration also. All the best, The D'Amico family Dayton, OHIO USA

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: masulliv
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and I have to say the only thing it has going for it is the location. The hotel itself is shabby, needs a total gutting and rehab. A few things: Shower completely lost power while hair was lathered with soap, finally got it to dribble a bit. It must have been shower rush hour which should not happen. The hair dryer is useless. Room is not very clean, beds are worn to a fray. Pillows are like flat rocks. Paint is chipped and dirty. Wallpaper is torn. I would not go near the extra blanket in the closet. Girl at the front desk was rude, period.

Reviews.Title: “Reception Staff helpful beyound the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: harmul
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family last week. This is an excellent value for money hotel, near TREVI FOUNTAIN and the VATICAN. The reception staff could not have been more helpfull and really went out of their way to be of assistance, arrangeing taxis, giving advice ect They even went to the Vatican to collect tickets for our group prior to our arrival as we would get in to late to collect them ourselves. One of our group has limited mobility and was looked after very well indeed

Reviews.Title: “The next time I visit Rome, there is no doubt I will return to Hotel Parlamento”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleMD
Reviews.Content: Even before we left for Italy, we had a good feeling about the Parlamento and our feelings were only confirmed when we arrived. Before our trip we communicated occasionally with the Parlamento staff via e-mail regarding transportation options to the other cities we were visiting, arrangements to see a soccer match, and confirming our room. We also used the Parlamento's airport transportation service for 55 EURO. Not so bad when a cab from the airport would be 50 EURO. From the moment we arrived, we felt like we were treasured guests in someone's house. While the Parlamento is certainly not the most glamorous hotel that you will ever find, you feel welcome every minute that you are there. Tiziano goes out of his way to help you in any way that he can, from showing you how to walk to a certain destination to offering you a cup of juice when you arrive after a long flight to guiding you to your room to offering expert advice on how to avoid lines at tourist attractions. He was the all-star of the hotel crew. Angelica and Roberto are also friendly, welcoming, and eager to assist. Location - SPECTACULAR. The only place in all of Rome that we took public transportation to was the Vatican. 5-10 minute walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon. 10-20 minute walk to the Colloseum and the Forum, Piazza Navona, the Jewish Quarter, Piazza del Popolo, and Campo de Fiori. 3 blocks away from Via de Convertite, home of the best shopping in all of Rome. Rooms - Ample. The only two complaints I'd have was that we could not get the in-room television to work, even with the intervention of Angelica (not the worst thing that can happen on a vacation) and the room suffered from a lack of cabinet space for clothes which we would have liked to unpack a little bit more. Still, a comfortable bed, a quiet room, as requested, and really, it's just a place to take a late afternoon nap and sleep at night. Other features - Breakfast was more than sufficient... grapefruit and orange juice, espresso, american coffee, or cappucino, a variety of cereals, and a variety of cold breads with different spreads. Trust me, you don't want a huge and heavy hot breakfast before a long day of walking. The rooftop garden was a superb way to take an afternoon off from sightseeing... bask in the warm Italian sun, listen to the sounds of Rome, read a book, and sip from a bottle of Chianti. Bottom line is this - when my wife and I go back to Rome, we can't wait to visit our friends at the Parlamento again. And we would recommend this hotel to anybody who we ever speak to who plans a visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, friendly, and immaculate”
Reviews.Author: Minerva12
Reviews.Content: A cozy, quaint, and quiet bed and breakfast so conveniently located, smack in between all of Rome's attractions. Perfect for families and singles alike. Sip on a bottle of wine at dusk while enjoying the spectacular rooftop as the adjacent campanello (bell tower) softly sings. The knowledgeable and attentive staff is the kindest, most charming and 24 hours. If you are party of two, request room 90.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return without a doubt, best hotel I've stayed in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Chriis219
Reviews.Content: The hotel Parlamento was everything I was looking forward to and more. The location is perfect, minutes away from the Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, and Pantheon and also minutes away from the main squares of town where bars and fine restaurants are found. Upon arriving, the owner of the hotel kindly greets us and gives us complimentary orange juice and shows us our room. The room was great, wonderfully decorated, huge nice bathroom, a window with a street view of Rome, and the beds were quite comfortable. The staff at this hotel were amazingly nice and tried so hard to help us plan trips, find restaurants, and get around. The breakfast was delicious, continental, but still much better than any hotel I've stayed in Italy. Overall a great deal and a wonderful hotel for people of all ages and all occasions, hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mbsh
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel, we were greated by the owner who offered us a cold drink and snack and immediately made us feel very welcome. He provided a map of the city and marked all the important sites with suggestions on transportation, walking, etc. Our room was small but very clean and quiet. The staff was v ery helpful booking a tour of the Vatican and recommending restaurants for dinner. Each afternoon, we would purchase a bottle of wine and enjoy it on the rooftop terrace - a perfect way to end a day! A cold breakfast is served by 7 each morning by charming staff. Finally, the staff arranged a car to bring us to the airport. A great overall experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LJA4LJANY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to one of the other couples we traveled with. What a find. Walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Pantheon. The staff were all very friendly & helpful, especially Tiziano & Andrea. The rooms were spotless. We highly recommed this hotel when you travel to Rome. We will stay there again on our return visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Parlamento will always be our first choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jazzie35
Reviews.Content: There is nothing like getting off to a good start on a much anticipated vacation. The staff at the Hotel Parlamento did just that for us. From my first email to them last August, they were always prompt and professional in their response. We arrived mid March and were greeted with a smile and a courtesy that made us feel instantly at home. The hotel was spotlessly clean and fresh, the beds were very comfortable, and there was a safe in each room. The location couldn't have been better with the Spanish Steps or Trevi Fountain less than 10 minutes walking distance. Even the Vatican was only about a 30 minute walk. We thought it was a great value. Service, whether breakfast or housekeeping, was delivered with enthusiasm. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful place to have a cup of their delicious capuccino or enjoy a glass of wine, and take in the energy and magnificence of Rome. The "icing on the cake" came immediately after we left Rome for the Amalfi Coast. We had a little train "adventure" and could not reach our pre-arranged driver or upcoming hotel by cell phone, to make alternative arrangements. We called back to Hotel Parlamento and Tiziano took time out of what was clearly a busy time to assist us. We will never forget this kindness. It solidifed what had already been an excellent experience. We wll certainly always choose this family run establishment if we are fortunate enough to again visit Rome. In summary, our best memories are of the graciousness of the Italian people, as represented by this family. I hope we can emulate this spirit as we encounter visitors to our own country, the United States.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bowsie
Reviews.Content: You simply cannot beat this hotel for location.All of tourist Rome is within walking distance.The metro stop at the Spanish Steps is an easy 10 minute walk or the nearest taxi rank is 2 minutes away.The hotel itself is a typical small 4th floor premises,inexpensive but spotlessly clean and very friendly staff.The rooms with access out onto the roof terrace are worth the extra premium for the comfort of sitting out and relaxing after trekking around the city all day ! It would be a first choice for a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: MNMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Our family booked two rooms for our stay at Hotel Parlamento for the first two nights and the last night of our trip to Rome and the Amalfi coast. The location of the Hotel Parlamento is perfect. We walked to all our sight-seeing destinations. Rooms on the courtyard are quieter than those that face the street. Rooms have "old world" personality with high ceilings, chandeliers, heavy draperies and chifforobes. While some of the bathrooms are tiny, others are quite spacious. Rooms were clean and well-equipped. The breakfast (included) was served in a cozy area of tables, chairs and benches. Although the breakfast foods were the typical offerings of cold cereals, toast, rolls, etc., it was nice to have the coffee/tea delivered to the table in a small pot. The hotel employees at the reception desk and in the breakfast room were friendly and helpful at all times. We were completely happy with our decision to book rooms at Hotel Parlamento. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great location but...”
Reviews.Author: panther029
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parlamento for 10 nights and loved it until the morning we checked out. That's when we discovered we had to pay 10 Euros per night more than the email confirmation they had sent me quoted. They showed me an alleged 'follow-up' email which I had never seen before. Ruined an otherwise very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-- Great Find InThe Middle Of Everything”
Reviews.Author: haley2334
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Walking distance to most of the major tourist attractions, very close to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps and close to the metro station. The room was a little small but compared to the others I've stayed in throughout Europe it seemed to be normal. The price was great, inexpensive for everything you get. They even bring breakfast to your room if you want at no addtional cost (continental breakfast is included in the price). I would definitely stay here again the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Pleasant Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: gogsdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and Three teenagers visited Rome and stayed at the Hotel and found it to be everything we wanted and then some.... The staff was helpful and could not assist enough. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it here, would stay again if I was budgeting”
Reviews.Author: SuperSC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location which is why I am really happy we stayed here. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the room was much bigger than expected. We actually really enjoyed staying here. Check in was easy and the room was quiet. It overlooked the courtyard and we could leave our windows open at night without it being noisy. Breakfast was included and it was really delicious. They served coffee with a pot of warm milk which has made me now love heating up my milk before I put it in my coffee. There is a selection of croissants, toast, cereals, oatmeal and yogurt along with juice. Oh and of course Nutella, which I made sure to indulge in every morning. We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May and spent a fair amount of time in our room in between walking around the city. They had a tv (see attached picture) which got a few english speaking channels which we weren't necessarily expecting. The bathroom was a good size too, especially for Europe. For 150 euro a night I think it was a good value for the price. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel parlamento”
Reviews.Author: blondd
Reviews.Content: what a find!! a big thank you to previous trip advisor reviews on this property. it is all about location. the hotel is 5 to 10 minutes from all the major attractions in rome -the trevi fountain the pantheon, the spanish steps, buses, the metro and the via corso. The staff in the hotel is exceptional with 2 standouts being Tietzi at the front desk and Angelina in the breakfast room. Tietzi was kind, helpful and genuinely friendly. He also spoke excellent english. Angelina was just very sweet in the mornings with a 24 hour smile. our room was on the rooftop with amenities such as a safe, granite bathroom, shower jacuzzi etc. hope you too get to enjoy a stay at the HP.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, room was adequete”
Reviews.Author: crimson325
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for the money. The room was simple, but clean. The staff were all really helpful and friendly, both in person and by email. Our only complaint is that when we reserved the room, the staff did not make it clear that we would be given a room with two twin beds. The email said "double room," which we interpreted as a double bed, not two twins. This should have been clarified since we would have preferred one big bed. One tip - we read on Trip Advisor about the noise so requested a quiet room before arriving. They were very willing to accommodate so I wuold suggest you ask for this. Other than that, breakfast was great, price was right, location was amazing, views from the roof top were pretty, and it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely Roman Private Hotel”
Reviews.Author: don868
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Parlamento and give it rave reviews in all categories. Rooms and baths are a bit small but that is typical. Get the rooms that open to the balcony. Tizanos recommendations on restaurants is excellent. Ride the double decker tour bus first and then explore by foot. We look forward to returning to Rome and will definitively stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great option!”
Reviews.Author: Xanshe
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good hotel on a good location, and this hotel was a great choice. My girlfriend and I stayed 4 nights there, and we had a nice time. The staff was very friendly, the room ok and the breakfast at the terrace was a nice experience. We definitely recommend this hotel to young couples like us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLiew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Parlamento for 4 nights. Rome was the last city we visited in Italy after spending 2 nights in Venice and 3 nights in Florence. For the same price, we got much bigger, nicer and newer rooms in Venice and Florence. I guess we expected more from Parlamento, which might not be very fair since it is only a 2-star hotel. Our room was dated and fairly small but clean. Location was excellent with Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps not more than 10 minutes walk. There were also many good restaurants and a taxi stand nearby. Also, the shopping area is only a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: SoCalDixieGal
Reviews.Content: Great two star hotel in central Rome close to all the major sites. I don't know what people expect from a two star hotel, but this place is a great find at a really nice price. You will be hard pressed to find better within this price range. I recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel Parlemento and found it on par with the other 2 and 3 star hotels I stayed in throughout Italy. Yes, the rooms, bathrooms and lifts are small - welcome to Italy! Our room was on the street side and it was pretty noisy, even with earplugs street noise was a bit of a problem, but was the tadeoff for being in the heart of things. Palantine Hill/Forum about 10 min walk. Trevi Fountain about 5 minutes away. There's one short flight of stairs after taking the lift to the hotel floor so be prepared to haul your bags up some stairs. The hotel staff was welcoming, provided recommendations, advice and was overall pleasant. You can also purchase a bottle of wine from the desk and head to the rooftop porch for a nice relaxing evening. Bathrooms provide small shampoo packets and little bars of soap so you may want to bring your own. A blowdryer is also provided in the bathroom but isn't great. The breakfast was a basic continental and it was great to have the option of cappucino! Overall a pleasant stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “You are paying for the location and NOT MUCH ELSE...”
Reviews.Author: josiec
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of all the raves on Tripadvisor but apart from the location were not overly impressed and indeed disappointed. Yes it is a "charming "little hotel but LITTLE is the the word, from the tiny lift, the tiny room and bathroom we had, the tiny breakfast room with benches that were so small we were very uncomfortable. Pity the family who had the room giving straight on to the breakfast room-to get from their room to the exit etc they had to get people breakfasting to move as otherwise they could not get past! The men on reception were all very formal in suits and not as we had expected from other reviews and not particularly friendly. Thank goodness for the lovely ,smiling lady who does the breakfasts-SHE had a charming manner and cheered up our mornings and actually spoke to us. Our room was needing a complete update. Yes it was charmingly furnished in a sort of second -hand shop sort of way( and at least the bed was comfy) but the wardrobe would not shut ,the drawers in the side tables stuck, the bathroom was very shabby and the wallpaper all very scuffed and marked. The breakfast was very poor.A fruit salad out of a tin,yoghurts, nice rolls and ??croissants but not as we know them, jams and butter in the packets and muesli, cocopops, cornflakes etc. I am sorry but when you are being charged over £100 per night as we were I think they could do better. A bowl of FRESH fruit would have been a start. They could not offer much more selection anyway as there was nowhere to put anything!!! Everything was done for their ease and convenience. Okay-it was only 2 star so what do we expect-a little more evidence that they care about their guests instead of a money making machine as that is the impression we were left with.( It was 12 euros extra a night for AC!!)Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: cquad40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, a few steps from Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps and next to a bus terminal where you can find buses to many other spots. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Detroit08_8
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the hospitality we received at this charming hotel. The entire staff is involved in making sure that guests have everything they need and more. All are fluent in English and aware of travelers' needs, directing them to the best locations in Rome, all surprisingly within walking distance from the hotel. We opted to use the hotel's limo service, a good choice considering we had heavy baggage and had never been to Italy. Upon arrival, we were offered coffee, fruit, etc. and a warm welcome. The room was spotless, elegantly furnished, and quiet, perfect for resting under the cool breeze from the window. We looked forward to an ample breakfast every morning and a look at the stars every evening on the lovely rooftop terrace. I was lucky enough to have a look at some of the other rooms with our host, all were unique and distinctive. Perfect spots for a perfect Rome holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: BLGO
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay here. We had an air conditioned Quad room which was big enough to walk around in even with the suit cases out. The location is perfect for walking to all of the sites, but best of all its close enough to get back to in order to rest. We loved using the patio in the evenings to relax with a glass of wine and recharge before heading out for our evening of strolls. The staff was friendly and professional. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel at a great value”
Reviews.Author: NYers
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome on our honeymoon, and this being our first time in Europe, we were very nervous. We had only heard of this hotel via Tripadvisor. It was literally central to all of Romes attractions (across the street from the Parliament).Upon arriving, we were warmly greeted by the concierge, Andre. Andre made us feel so at home. He was extremely helpful and down to earth. Upon leaving, we felt like we had made a new friend. The hotel is very cozy. The room is a bit larger than an average room in Europe. Ask for the room with the balcony access. The bathrooms are brand-new, although the shower is small, it is common in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “super location”
Reviews.Author: newmarkethome
Reviews.Content: After reading a positive review in Frommer's guide to europe , I contacted this hotel directly via fax and e-mail . Their responses were fast , courteous and very helpful . They were even able to accomodate last minute changes made by e-mail from europe , when our original train plans changed . Upon arrival at their unassuming front door , we were confronted with the hotel's one and only draw-back ( and perhaps the reason behind the excellent price ) : stairs... quite a few stairs to the lobby . There is a very small elevator that goes part-way there , but there is no avoiding the stairs. Once in the lobby , we were met with the greatest hospitality , we were shown to our spotlessly clean room with perfect modern washroom . During our week there our every request was met with instant assistance , whether for walking directions from the front desk staff , or for an espresso from Philomena , the wonderful breakfast hostess . This hotel is excellently placed for walking old Rome ; 5 minutes to the Trevi fountain , 5 minutes to the spanish steps , 15 minutes to the vatican in one direction or the colliseum in the other , the shopping of via corso on the doorstep , and myriad outdoor restaurants also within a short stroll . I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ScotKent
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and will return on our next visit to Rome. The hotel is in a fanstatic location for all of the sites. Everything is within walking distance including the Vatican and St Peters Basilica, 5 mins from Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and great shopping, 10 mins from Pantheon. All of the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms and bathrooms are of a good size and very clean. The roof terrace is ideal for breakfast in summer or relaxing after a day sightseeing. Having stayed in other hotels in Rome, which do not compare favourably in either location, accomodation or service, we were delighted to have found the Parlamento and would have no hesitation in recommending it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: franco4
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 night stay at Hotel Parlamento during a recent 2 week vacation in Italy. The small size of the hotel makes it feel intimate. The location is super convenient to walk to everything--very near the Spanish Steps. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially Tiziano. They gave us great recommendations for restaurants. They also organized a car to pick us up from the airport. The hotel was clean, the breakfast was great and it was a good sized room for 2 adults and 2 children. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Acceptable Hotel in a Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SabaOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights in the Parlamento in July 2008. We were only refreshing ourselves on Rome, having spent a number of longer stays there in the past, and we wanted a good location to be able to walk to most of the popular spots. We were arriving after an overnight flight, so accepted their offer of a limo pickup at Fiumencino for 55 Euro. There was some confusion about the location for meeting, but eventually we did connect and it turned out to be worth-while because the hotel is not really marked in any way except for a small sign on the doorbell at street level - I am not sure that we ever would have found it on our own. The hotel is situated on two upper floors of a building (advertized as a "palace"), accessed by a tiny elevator. The reception is a rather cluttered space in an open area on the first of their floors, adjacent to their breakfast room Our first impression was a little concerning, but they welcomed us in a friendly way with offers of juice and water and took our bags up one floor to a clean and adequately-sized room. We paid the 12 Euro extra for air-conditioning (essential!). We had also paid 20 Euro extra for a room with direct access to their roof-top terrace. We enjoyed taking out a glass of wine from our room each evening at the end of our touring, but we could have had equal access to it without paying the extra price. Breakfast was served in the quite small breakfast room (also a bit cluttered and slighlty worn ,and hot on a July day), but the server relocated our tray (standard coffee/tea, croissants/rolls and jam and juice) up to the terrace, which we enjoyed. Desk staff gave us a few good choices for dinner nearby and were helpful with maps and directions. The situation was, indeed, ideal - at the corner of the Corso and in walking distance to Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Piazza Venezia and the Forum, and very close to Spanish Steps (with access from there to the Metro). Overall, we were completely satisfied; only a bit disappointed that it wasn't quite as "pallatial" as the web-site implied and a little more worn than it looked on line. Considering it was classed as two-star, we got our money's worth and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GreekGodLimassol
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 5 nights in this small but perfectly formed hotel, it was a birthday present to my girlfriend who had never been to Rome, from the outset everything worked well, we booked a taxi through them to pick us up from the Airport, it was on time. We booked in with the minimum of fuss it was then we realised what a gem we had found, it's location was the main thing, less than 10mins from the Spanish Steps, the same from the Fountains of Trevi & no more than 20mins from most of the other sites, so no need for expensive taxi's, the Vatican was the furthest place & we cought a train 1euro each way? The second thing we liked about the Hotel was the helpfullness of the staff, giving us restaurants to go to, short cuts to places, nothing was to much trouble, there is a roof garden to relax in after a hard day site seeing, the bedroom while not large was perfect for us (didn't spend to much time there) the room had A/C but they charge extra for it. The continental breakfast was excellent & set us up for the day, all in all a wonderfull holiday the best way I can sum it up is, Location, Location, Location Thankyou Hotel Parlamento

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsminNH
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to stay in Rome. We are a family of four and were given a quad - one large room with a side smaller room, bathroom and private balcony. The location of the hotel is fantastic; a quick walk to La Fontana di Trevi and Piazza di Spagna and not much further to other popular places. Plus there is a taxi stand and bus terminal right down the street in Piazza San Silvestro. The breakfast was great, simple but adequate and the cappucino was fantastic! What truly makes this hotel is the extremely helpful staff - a big thank you to Tiziano and Roberto and a extra big thanks to Andrea for going out of his way to solve our car rental dilemma. I will definitely stay here again! Francesca, New Hampshire

Reviews.Title: “Parlamento - A-OK!”
Reviews.Author: BillMassParkNY
Reviews.Content: The Parlamento excelled in many areas - location is excellent within easy walking distance of the Steps, the Parthenon, the Metro and many, many excellent restaurants especially in the Campo de' Fiori area; the hotel itself was super clean - a feature not to be minimalized; the staff was very friendly and eager to answer all questions; and the morning continental breakfast surpassed our expectations - fresh baked goods and varied ingredients - here again the serving staff was tops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect outdoor terrace at end of day”
Reviews.Author: frizzylee
Reviews.Content: The owners/employees could not have been nicer or more heplful. Through them, we had arranged for a ride from the airport. While pricey (70 EURO for 4 people), we were glad we did it. After flying all night we did not want to hassle with trying to figure out where and how to get transportation to the hotel when we were exhausted. As we had arrived mid-morning, our room was not quite ready. They kept our bags which allowed us to go see the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain- both within easy reach of the hotel. The hotel is in the city so there was quite a bit of street noise. However, it was early May so we were able to sleep with the windows closed. We had a quad room for our family of four. Though cozy, it suited us fine. The breakfast was perfect- fruit (albeit canned), yogurt, assorted cereals, fresh rolls and croissants, coffee, juice. However, by far, the best aspect of our stay was the rooftop terrace. At the end of a busy day touring, we bought a bottle of wine from a street merchant who uncorked it and gave us plastic glasses. We would then sit on the terrace and review our day in Rome. Keep in mind, Rome is crazy busy and congested- the rooftop terreace was a welcome respite from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “4 Beds in One Room in Rome -- A Miracle!!”
Reviews.Author: mckmpls
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Babe's suggestion on this site, we made a reservation at Hotel Parlamento and we are so glad we did! First and foremost, it is no small feat to find a hotel room in Rome, especially centrally located, and most especially that doesn't break the bank. Hotel Parlamento was very reasonable, for the city. And the room was surprisingly roomy! After staying in Paris, and learning just how small rooms, cars and elevators can be, our room was positvely spacious in comparison. Our room was divided in half, with a walkway into the other section where our kids slept. Beyond that was our own little patio (looking out onto a bell tower) and there was also another larger patio for the patrons to share. The gentleman at the front desk (wish I could recall his name) was lovely. We had very intersting conversations about traveling throughout Europe, and he was very helpful with suggestions for getting around, and mapping walking trips onto a map for us. All of the staff were very friendly. My only complaint would be that the breakfast left a lot to be desired. Lastly, the location was fantastic! We only had 2 days to spend in Rome, so having such a convenient location was really helpful. You're right by the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps (the steps are very underwhelming by the way, especially with current construction). And the hotel is also right by a major Piazza from which the majority of city buses and taxis leave from. Very handy. All in all, I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, for it's pleasant atmosphere, wonderful location, very competitive rate, and most especially for it's rooms for 4!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Lovely Hotel in a Very Safe Neighbourhood!”
Reviews.Author: VarietyOntario
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this small, but very quaint hotel. It has a wonderful staff to greet you, check in was quick (they already knew our name, and were expecting us). They allowed us to check in very early (10am). We had ordered a car to pick us up at the airport, and the driver was there when we arrived (somewhat late). Ou room had 2 windows, with one that opened up onto the rooftop garden. It was a wonderful view of the city. This hotel is centrally located in a VERY safe neighbourhood. Our room had a great queen-sized bed, and we were very comfortable. The staff were SO accommodating, and very cordial. We cannot say enough about how wonderful they were. We would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a lovely, safe place to stay in Rome. It was central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Rome revisited”
Reviews.Author: medik
Reviews.Content: I have had a previous holiday in Rome - 50 years ago, as a young student, so it was high time to revisit - particularly as my wife had never been to the city. Encouraged by other reviews, we booked at the Parlamento. We found it to be an unpretentious hotel with limited facilities - in keeping with its small size (23 rooms). It has, however, several positive attributes that are worth emphasising. First, its location. It is within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon, and a 20 minute walk will take you to the Forum and the Colloseum. Second, the Chini family who run the hotel are friendly and helpful, and all speak good English. Third, the charges are modest. We paid 160 euros per night (inclusive of breakfast) for an adequately sized room with a well-appointed bathroom. Breakfast is a simple affair - cereals, rolls, croissants, coffee or tea - but quite sufficient unless you feel that eggs and bacon or cold meats are a necessary start to the day, in which case you will have to eat out! While the breakfast area is small, you can take it on the roof-top terrace (as we did) or in the privacy of your room. Inevitably there are a few draw-backs. The hotel's central location on a busy street means that it is noisy. The double windows have to be closed at night, and if the weather is hot you will need to have air-conditioning for which an additional charge is levied (12 euros per night). Furthermore, the hotel is on the 3rd and 4th floors of an ancient building; there is a miniscule lift, but you stll have to climb a short flight of stairs to reach Reception. Mind you, if you cannot negotiate a few stairs I would advise that you take a holiday in Rome off your itinerary! All in all, the Parlamento offers good value and its central location and helpful staff amply compensate for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: wicklowlassindublin
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to stay if you are looking for somewhere centrally located that won't break the bank. It's less than 3 mnutes walk to the Trevi fountain, right off Cosi, the central shopping street, there's a subway station metres away and about a 20 minute walk to the Vatican/the collosseum. Definitely recommend this hotel, simple but very functional with helpful cheerful staff. Lovely roof terrace where you can have breakfast, internet connection (v. expensive), very clean, generally a very good find. Might be an idea to request a quiet room if you're a light sleeper due to central location. 92 was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nobfam4
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel May 08 and loved the location. The staff was great.. Upon arrival Tiziano greeted us and spent time with us guiding us in the right direction..his guidance was most appreciated. As in the other posts the hotel has an excellent location in the middle of the tourist spots. The highlight of our days was taking a bottle of wine to the rooftop after a busy day of sightseeing. Again we cannot say enough about the staff. Tiziano and Paolo were so helpful. We would definitely stay again. Thanks J&J

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tnworldtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in the Hotel Parlamento and thought it was great. The location is excellent. The property is right in the middle of the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and Pantheon...walking distance to just about anywhere. We had room 106 directly adjacent to the rooftop patio. The room was basic but nice and not too small. The bathroom was updated, very clean upon arrival, and was well cleaned daily. We had the hotel arrange airport transfer which was very convenient and provided a smooth start to our trip. The breakfast was a bit sparse. The lift does not go all the way to the lobby level. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent for a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: lmdima33
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a room at the Hotel Parlamento last minute while staying in Tuscany. We did not have time to book our Rome hotel prior to leaving home and figured we would stay anywhere. This was a true find and we were very fortunate to have lucked out with this hotel at this price in the center of everything. The staff was wonderful especially Andrea. They could not do more for you and are so friendly and accomodating. We walked everywhere and did not need to take a cab except to get to the airport. We walked to Colusseum, Campo de Fiori, Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. It is not a fancy place and the room was a bit small and dingy but the bathroom is nice and clean and adequate. I did not care for the breakfast but again, I am not big on the "american" coffee and pastries in all of Italy. I do recommend this hotel for its location and customer service. Kudos to the family who runs this!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: DianeStevens
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parlamento turned out to be a wonderful choice to stay while in Rome. As we were interested in "Old Rome", we chose this hotel as it is located close to many attractions, but it is also convenient to buses and the train station for further excursions. The staff could not be more helpful, from serving you your first cup of coffee with the morning breakfast that is included with your stay, until you turn in your key on the last day, they answered our questions and guided us very well. Americans will quickly notice this is not your average chain hotel, but one morning's breakfast on the roof will quickly charm you with the quaintness of the place. Best of all, walk out the front door and you will find yourself quickly walking to areas of Rome that have been there for centuries!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, excellent location, congenial staff”
Reviews.Author: cnjones
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parlmento is a small jewel. Our stay was wonderful in every way. The rooms are small but adequate. Construction is complete, so no noise or dust, or inconvenience. Tiziano is very accomodating. He helped us get our lost luggage from the airport, making numerous calls every day. He recommended some really good restaurants in the area. The location is superb. The shopping is great. Excellent value. Try to get one of the rooms that open to the rooftop patio.

Reviews.Title: “Courtesy and professionalism on a shoestring!”
Reviews.Author: avastara
Reviews.Content: My father found the hotel in a travel book and reserved the room. I have stayed in Rome three times before (some places were much more expensive and who wants to send time in a hotel when you are in Rome?), but never here. I was skeptical at first based on the "budget" rating in the guide book. I have to say, the hotel is in an amazing location in Centro near the Spanish Steps. The staff was not only friendly, they went above and beyond to make the stay more enjoyable by providing extensive directions, assisting with touristic information and recommending local favorites. Courtesy and professionalism on a shoestring!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Parlamento a gem!”
Reviews.Author: 3travelerspa
Reviews.Content: Our 1 week trip to Rome could have been ruined when our 10 year-old fell ill on day 3, but instead we can't wait to go back, thanks to the staff at Hotel Parlamento. A hotel is more than the rooms, location & amenities. It is the people who run the show and set the tone for the guests. These guys (and gal) were just super - helped us feel comfortable visiting "their" city for the first time, and when we hit a snag, helped us rearrange our week to meet our needs, including securing a room at another hotel for the one night that they simply could not accommodate us. As owner/operators, they were genuinely interested in making our stay and our entire experience the best it could be. Details re: the hotel itself - there are several steps/stairs to get to the hotel lobby, and then to the rooms, which could be a challenge for someone with limited mobility, but really, Rome as a whole is not very "accessible" so I wouldn't think this would be an issue for most people. We found breakfast to be very fine, including three types of breakfast cereal with milk to supplement a more typical European continental breakfast selection. There is a supermarket one block away for a broad selection of fruit, picnic lunch provisions, food & drinks for afternoon snacks on the lovely roof patio, etc. This is not a "5-star" hotel - there is no room service, you cannot independently adjust the heat/air, bathrooms & showers are small. The rooms are each different and typically small by American standards, but we had plenty of space for 3 in our room. Some street noise should be expected when staying right in the center of everything, I actually think the windows were more sound-tight than most in a hotel of this type. What else to say? We felt Hotel Parlamento was an excellent value - not the cheapest place we could find, nor the most luxurious, but met our needs and exceeded our expectations. We had several lengthy conversations with a few of the staff, discussing politics (Italian & American), tourism, and food. To say they speak English well is an understatement - we speak no Italian! We both come from hotel & restaurant backgrounds and are generally hyper-critical when we travel, so this experience really stands out. We will be back, gladly and often! Stayed April 9 - 15, 2008 visiting from a suburb of Philadelphia, PA

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Bonni5909
Reviews.Content: I just left the hotel yesterday, and felt compelled to write about the wonderful experience I had there. The staff could not have been more helpful. Not only during my stay, but in the months prior, in which they answered my numerous email questions. Their helpfulness ranged from assisting with getting my cell phone going to making dinner reservations for truly one of the best meals I've ever had. The location was great. The elevator was working. Special thanks to Titiano! I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: aitravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great--very friendly, very helpful, answered all our questions, made sure we knew how to get around the city, etc. The front desk staff does speak English so if Italian isn't your first language, it's not a problem to communicate with them. It is worth noting that I don't speak Italian but my friend does. They were much friendlier and more talkative with her (having conversations with her in Italian and providing additional insight about Rome, which was a nice, added bonus for us because I'm not sure we would've been privy to such great insight had we been English-only speakers). The hotel occupies the top two floors of a building in central Rome. You need to climb one set of stairs to get to the elevator (which will take you up the equivalent of four flights of stairs). Once you get off the elevator, you will need to climb one more set of stairs to get to the front entrance of the hotel. The elevators are small--it can comfortably fit two average-sized people, three at most--without luggage. We are in good physical shape, so climbing the stairs is not a problem for us. However, if you have limited mobility, it may be tricky for you to reach the hotel entrance. It is in an excellent location! You can walk to just about anything in central Rome from this location. Additionally, the major bus stops are less than a hundred meters away if you need to take it anywhere (convenient for us when we went to Villa Borghese and Termini Station). The rooms are basic but clean. They installed double windows so most of the street noise is blocked out (the hotel is smack dab in the middle of the city--lots of noise all around--so the double windows did a great job). However, the doors leading to the hallway don't provide as much of a sound barrier. We could hear our neighbors coming and going...and staying....standing in front of our doors. A small safe is provided, which I appreciated. The room offered adequate space; bathroom was spacious but our shower stall was small by US standards--not uncommon in my experience in European cities, though. The beds looked like cots with a thin mattress but they were comfortable enough for me for three nights. For us, it was a good a choice--a good balance between being wallet-friendly and having good, basic accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jess1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy or plush but is a good place to sleep while in Rome. The location is nice near the high end shopping area and Spanish Steps. Our room was slightly strange, the door opened to stairs with the bathroom 1/2 way up but compelelty acceptable. The breakfast was rather lack luster but again acceptable. The staff was really friendly with planning out the day. They also recommended great small restuarants where we really felt like locals. They were also very helpful with making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: jessicadanielle
Reviews.Content: The first time I was in Rome, I stayed at this hotel. And I'm so glad I did! Although the entryway was going through some maintenance, you could still imagine the beauty of the hotel. I traveled with my mother, father, sister and uncle (who had a separate room). The room fit us four perfectly, with a double bed, a twin, and a daybed. The furniture was gorgeous and the bathroom was quite spacious. Every morning we would have breakfast in the Breakfast Room which was so adorable! But I must say, the best part of the hotel was the terrace. Nothing's better after a long day of sightseeing and tours then enjoying some snacks and wine on the gorgeous terrace. The hotel was centrally located near the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and Via Del Corso had amazing shops! Oh, and Hotel Parlamento was very close to an indoor mall (for all those avid shoppers!).
