Also, the staff was extremely nice, especially Tiziano. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastico”
Reviews.Author: Venezia07
Reviews.Content: My one year old daughter, wife, mother and sister in law loved the Parlamento. The Service OUTSTANDING...the location CENTRAL...The people were really helpful and friendly the quad room was very spacious. FANTASTIC il Parlamento we will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “a little gem - great location + friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-tour
Reviews.Content: Previous recommendations on trip advisor re Parlamento were right. This is a terrific little hotel, with a great location and very friendly staff. The room was clean comfortable and very quite. While the hotel is located up a few flights of stairs, the lift is being upgraded to reach the entrance so that will save tired legs. We (self, wife and two teenage boys 14 + 18yrs ) booked the family room and found it to be very comfortable. Breakfast - cereal, croissants coffee etc was sufficient to fill the boys. The hotel had internet available at a reasonable price and the staff were very helpful assisting us to book tours, taxis and pickup from the airport, which I would recommend to everyone. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally made it.”
Reviews.Author: KevanGoodworth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, 60 yr old Australians with 35 yrs of international travelling behind us on every continent, spent a week at the Parlamento in January. The reviews you will read are accurate; good value, excellent location, helpful staff etc. We had a roof top room. Have a look at the delightful Chiesa San Silvestro next door, a real sanctuary. The large Auto Grill across the street sells everything from pizza to pasta, primi e secondi, wine, gelato, confectionary etc; eat in or take out. This is a cheap alternative to the good local restaurants the staff recommend. Taxis and buses in the square next door, post box 3minutes, similarly Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi, close, walk to Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori, Forum Romana, Colisseo etc. Stayed at the Sienna last year nearby but this beats it for cost. Internet @ 10euros an hour, great champagne bar in the Hotel Homs nearby which does a 6 euro degustation. Book early. I tried last year and missed out, 3 months ahead. Serious travellers will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: ilovetravelling_bcn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Hotel Parlamento for 4 nights last week and it was lovely. The staff are very nice, friendly and helpful. They spoke very good Spanish and English too. The location of the hotel is unbeatable, just a few streets from Fontana di Trevi, Piazza di Spagna and the Spanish Steps. Our double room was clean, quiet and comfortable and opened out onto a roof terrace which overlooked the Via della Convertite and nearby Piazza Mignanelli below. We didn’t really make much use of it as it was January :( A continental style breakfast was included in the price, which was nice and convenient. Great choice/ value for its location and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “so good, so central”
Reviews.Author: ohebb
Reviews.Content: I took a group of 11 ladies to Italy last September and our first stop was Rome. I hadn't stayed at the Parlamento with previous groups and was naturally apprehensive but had received courteous and prompt replies to my early accomodation queries. I was very pleased with everything about this hotel - from the smiling greetings, cleanliness, central location, staff who always made time to deal with us (especially as the luggage of 7 of us stayed missing for 1-2 nights) and breakfasts nicely served by ever-smiling Filomena. All of us agreed we could not have found anywhere better and I will certainly be back with my next group. Molto grazie! Tiziano, Paolo, Andrea and Filomena (Heather Ebbott, Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pensione”
Reviews.Author: youngaussie
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome and at this hotel. The location was fantastic; half way between Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. I read a lot about the hotel before booking it. It's in an larger building right off Via Del Corso. We couldn't find it at first, but then saw the sign. It's in the building next to Energie on the corner and you just have to buzz to get in. The new elevator was being put in so you climb two sets of stairs to get to the elevator (small, can only fit two people and two medium sized suitcases) which you take up a few floors to get to the Parlamento reception. The reception people were always friendly, but quiet. We didn't really ask for their recommendations on anything, but they were always helpful when we asked questions or for directions. Our room was one more flight of stairs up (the lady helped with our bags). The room had a lot of charm. It felt like an old style room, but we were very impressed with the bathroom. It was renovated and relatively new. The only complaint about the room was that it felt a little cavernous (small window you can open to let light in) and the stairs you use to get up to the bedroom area was oddly placed by the bathroom. You can't help but trip. The other thing was that the heating was centrally controlled. It would get extremely hot in the early evening, but then they would turn it off in the middle of the night so the morning was quite cold. Wish we could control our own heating. The breakfast was okay. The seating area off the reception area was small. By the last day, I went out for a cappuccino and brioche (more Italian) which was great. Having a great location was key as we could go back to relax/rest during the day. Overall, I do this recommend this hotel. We got a pretty good rate being there during the off season. The room was quiet, the hotel was quaint, and the location was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “the Parllamento”
Reviews.Author: Kipawa
Reviews.Content: All of the good reviews of the Parlamento are correct. It is excellent value, perfect location, and wonderful staff. Titsiano, Paolo, Andreas, and Roberto could not have been more friendly or helpful, from advising where and how to go to various locations to great recommendations for restaurants. The breakfast with seconds for Cappucino was perfect and the outside terrace if warm enough is super for relaxing , reading,a picknick lunch, or, a bottle of wine with cheese and prosuitto. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: strazztraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Everything was great from beginning to end. After booking on-line, they offered to have a driver meet us at the airport (Fiumicino). We highly recommend this because it is a hard hotel to find (it's tucked inside a busy downtown block). All the staff were extremely nice and helpful. The second floor rooms have doors that open directly to a patio for public use. This was the only thing that was distracting at times, especially when loud guests would gather outside late at night or people smoking right outside our room. The location couldn't be better though. We were able to walk comfortably in any direction (west to the Vatican, southwest to the Campo di Fiori, South to the Roman Forum, and north to the Villa Borghese). You really can't find a more friendly hotel in a better location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean, secure and all about the location”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here as a solo traveler in early November. The hotel is located on the corner of Convertite and via del Corso, which is a famously busy main street. However, given that the hotel is located off the street through a secured gate, through a courtyard and up 3 stories, there is no street noise at all. I felt very safe given the gate off the street and the buzzed-entry at the reception level. Disabled, mobility challenged or luggage challenged guests will want to know about the flight of stairs to the elevator and from the elevator to the reception level. My single room was quite tiny, more so than other singles I've stayed in throughout Europe. About 2 feet of walking space around the bed and a miniscule, hard to maneuver bathroom (climbing over the bidet into the shower). The bed had also seen better days. Yet the room was quite clean. The included breakfast was standard but delicious. The staff is quite friendly and very helpful. I had a 4 a.m. departure and someone was up and helping me out to the car. The main feature here is the location. I could get just about anywhere in centro storico in under 10 minutes. Lots of restaurants and shops locally. I'd probably stay here again because the price and location were great for me. I might upgrade to a bigger room but really, for the little time I was actually in the room it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: markenbc
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Parlamento pre-cruise. For the price and the location I would not even think of staying anywhere else. You are truly within walking distance to anywhere you want to go. The staff as everyone else has said are wonderful, full of suggestions and genuinely interested in where you are spending your day. The breakfast is fairly basic but delicious and fresh with good hot coffee!! The room was spotlessly clean and the bed, for a european bed was very comfortable and we slept well. Yes you have to climb up a flight of stairs before you arrive at the elevator but that is pretty much the norm for Rome. Great staff, great service, great location and clean comfy rooms - don't waste your time looking at other hotels. Just stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Best price for the location”
Reviews.Author: DSharpe
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from my 2nd stay at the Parlamento, and would gladly recommend it to anybody. The price can't be beat for the location, as you are in walking distance to virtually all that is relevant to a tourist in Rome. The rooms are clean, and the staff is extremely helpful. As other reviewers have mentioned they have lots of suggestions, and are available 24hrs. a day. They are happy to make arrangements for taxis to and from the airports with fixed prices that are very reasonable, or suggest good restaurants etc. They even gave me information on getting tickets and transportation to Stadio Olimpico to watch Lazio play, if you know the staff you realize this is very generous as they are avid AS Roma fans! I was there with myself and 7 other family members and their patience and assistance with us helped turn what could have been a chaotic trip to Rome, into one that was the best of my 5 trips there so far. So, if you're going to Rome don't hesitate to book the Parlamento. Thank you to all the staff at the Parlamento especially Paolo, Tiziano and Andrea......you've made both my stays at the Parlamento and in turn Rome that much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Parlemento”
Reviews.Author: bozoMinni
Reviews.Content: We just spent three lovely nights in a quad room at this nice hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful all through our visit to Rome. They provided ideas for tours and greatly aided our transit to/from the airport. (hire a car!) The rooms are basic, but comfortable and have their own facilities. The breakfast was included and it was very good and worthwhile. The greatest asset is the location. The hotel is centrally located and an easy walk to most of the sights! Getting into the hotel involves some stair climbing but it is relatively easy and worth it. We wound not hesitate to return to the Hotel Parlemento!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: almcd410
Reviews.Content: My friend and I loved our stay here (2 single females). Stayed the first 3 and last night in Rome at the Parlamento. You cannot beat it for the money and location. Staff: so very accommodating and friendly. They will offer to arrange tour, taxi and restaurant reservations. We decided to stay 2 nights beyond our reservations and because they were full, found us another nearby hotel within our price range. Location: cannot beat it! 3-25 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiori, Trevi Fountain, Ancient Rome, shopping, restaurants, bus/metro. Accommodations: clean with private baths; European continental breakfast included. Our first room was 120 euro and the room our last night cost 145 euro. It was worth the extra 25 euro to get the extra space. The rooftop garden is great! The 1 room that opens up to the rooftop garden is the one to get. Other guests that we met during our stay agreed that this place is great for the money.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay with great staff”
Reviews.Author: bronygraig
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from this hotel, yes it is a 2 star rated hotel, but don’t let this put you off nor the issue about the stairs. You will have to take your cases up 1 flight of stairs but then there is a lift, it does work, you have to go in it to trigger the light. We struggled passed it with our cases when arrived, then laughed about it for the rest of our stay when we realised our mistake. We had a wonderful 3 nights. The hotel is very clean and tidy, the staff cannot do enough for you, form recommending restaurants and pointing out places to visit. Their English is very good. Have the breakfast on the balcony, a great way to start the day. The hotel is central to all sites. We even had a free Genesis concert thrown in free, after all, I would not pay to go and see them. Our advice, take the hotels taxi service from & to the airport, a Mercedes all the way at a reasonable price. We were duped to take a taxi ride from the train station to the hotel, 35 Euros for about 2 miles or less, that hurt. Our room (96) was simple but clean with a large double bed. The room does overlook a busy street which could be very noisy if you were a very light sleeper, but the room has 2 set’s of double glazing and free air conditioning, even the lightest sleeper should get a good nights sleep. We are very heavy sleepers (guilt free conscience!) so we the windows open and the air con off. All in all an excellent, well located, reasonably priced hotel, I would stay there again and would recommend. Thank you again Tripadvisor reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: Bumpyone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located perfectly - not far away from most attractions, metro and bus stops. Construction is going on but the windows are so sound and light proof that we slept perfectly. The new elevator saves a few flights so carrying bags up wasn't the issue it once was. Rooms are small but clean and nice. Staff spoke perfect English and was very helpful. Breakfast was above average though nothing fancy and is available on the terrace as well as inside. There are double windows to avoid the street noise. Not enough can be said for the staff. They all were very helpful and their suggestions as to places to eat and methods for getting to the sights were most needed. Overall recommended for the price and service and especially location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lucky90
Reviews.Content: My niece and I stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for 4 nights then again (after our trip to Florence and Venice) for another 2 nights. It was great because the Hotel stored our luggage until our return. The staff at the hotel were fabulous... always offering to help with suggestions for dinner, etc. etc. The room was small but very clean. The bed was very comfortable after touring the city all day. The hotel is in a great location off Via Corso and very close to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. I highly recommend Hotel Parlamento and would definitely stay there when I return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Spot In The Heart Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Wall_NewJerseyRomana
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hotel Parlamento every year since 1995. Prior to that, when I was looking for a place to stay that was in the center of Rome, I had to choose between price or cleanliness. With the Hotel Parlamento, I did not have to compromise on either. This is by far , the best location in Rome, at a very very reasonable price, and it is spotlessly clean, the family-run hotel is very accomodating, everyone who works there is friendly, helpful and goes out of their way to take care of the clients and I have never been in a hotel where the housekeeping staff is as kind as they are here.There is a beautiful rooftop garden, and in spite of being in the center of the city, the rooms are very quiet because there are triple paned sound-proof windows. The hotel rooms have been renovated as have the bathrooms, and there is a very comfy breakfast area. One can feel as though they are at home! At the present time, there are outside renovations going on, but do not let that detract you from staying here during the renovation. This is truly the best spot to walk to almost every monument in the historic center, without ruining your budget. You will feel very much at home here, as many people such as myself, return year after year- the staff is wonderful and enjoyable too. Everyone speaks English and will be only too happy to help you to get around Rome and see the sights of their beautiful city. Ask for Andrea, he is a real sweetheart, loves to talk, loves to hear about the U.S. history, very curious about the history of the Italian emmigration to the U.S., and thoroughly enjoys helping people to love his city of Rome. I have said that even if I won the lottery and could afford any hotel in Rome, I would continue to stay at the Hotel Parlamento because it now feels like home ! Many members of my family have stayed at the hotel and I have sent many friends and everyone has enjoyed their stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just fair”
Reviews.Author: orthoarrow
Reviews.Content: I had read that the buildinng that this hotel was located in was still under renovation back several years ago. I was sure it would be finished by our trip in May. I was wrong. You come in off the street, walk through a construction area, climb 2 flights of stairs, take a tiny elevator one flight, then climb another flight to get to the lobby. The employees are very professional. The room was clean, but on a very noisy street. If we closed the window, the noise was gone, but then it was very hot. There was AC, but for an extra charge! Twelve euro a night. What a rip off. The location was good, which was one of the reasons I chose this hotel. However, I wouldn't stay here again. There have to be other hotels that are not such a hassle to get into, who include AC. Also, they require payment up front when you make the reservation, and it's non refundable. I made reservations 10 months in advance, requesting a couple of rooms, and they still couldn't promise those rooms to me. Instead we got a basic room one night, and when we were there a week later, a room that opened up to the reception desk. I'm not difficult to please, and go with the flow when in another county. But, I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: linnea0929
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located perfectly - not far away from any attractions, metro or bus stop. the construction is going on but the windows are so sound and light proof that we slept perfectly. rooms are small but clean and nice. bathroom had a large jaccuzzi which was great but the shower had no door so the floors got a little messy. staff spoke perfect english and was very helpful (though they did try to push the tours a little too much). the roof terrace is surprisingly tranquil - we spent every night out there. the hotel has a variety of drinks available for purchase so bringing a bottle of wine or champagne onto the terrace each night is a must. the value (given the location and the amenities) is pretty good. breakfast was above average though nothing fancy and is available on the terrace as well as inside. some of the rooms are literally right in the breakfast area so i probably would avoid that at all costs. there are double windows to avoid the street noise but the doors and walls tended to be pretty thin. the elevator was working so carrying bags up the four flights wasnt an issue. overall recommended for the price and service and especially location

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: homesnoozing
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience staying at the Hotel Parlamento in late March. Paolo and others on the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and repeatedly went out of their way to help us with restaurant reservations, directions, and whatever other information we needed. The neighborhood felt safe and comfortable for walking day or night, so we enjoyed walking to and from dinner near the Pantheon or the Spanish Steps every evening--both just a few minutes away. Our room was pleasant and quiet. We would definitely return to the Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been okay..”
Reviews.Author: Vandygirl
Reviews.Content: I heard wonderful things about the Parlamento but was kind of disappointed. Upon arrival we had to walk through a construction zone and carry our bags up a couple flights of stairs... with no assistance from the front desk staff. The room was dingy, with old wallpaper and bedding and you cant be the sound of power drills from downstairs upon you arrival! The bathroom was tiny, even by European standards. Upon booking the room we were told it included AC, but the front desk man said it was "broken", later to find out its just too loud and we really could use it. Upon check out once again no assitance down the stairs, even though they could clearly see our struggle. If I have one nice thing to say it is that the hotel is convenient, right off the Corso and close to Trevi and the Spanish Steps, but I would have walked 10 miles to get to those things and not be in such a hole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: laturista
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Parlamento was its oh-so-convenient location! It was close to all the sights. The Spanish Steps were 4 blocks away, the Trevi fountain was five minutes, as was the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. Campo Fiori was 10 minutes away and it only took us about 7 minutes to walk to the Collosseum late at night! The construction wasn't a major issue, as our room had double windows to block out any noise. The staff here was friendly and helpful, and breakfast was a huge asset. The rooms were large and the bathroom was a decent size with proper water pressure! The only downside was the relatively high price point and the less than impressive entryway. Other than that, a great bare-bones type of place!

Reviews.Title: “Sipping Prosecco on the Roof Garden”
Reviews.Author: sunnie77
Reviews.Content: For my second stay at this hotel (this time with my family of seven), we enjoyed the central location, very helpful staff, and the view from the roof garden. The construction on the ground floor is still in process, but it is not noticeable once you are inside the hotel. The staff assisted us in making restaurant reservations, locating the nearest self-help laundry, a van to take us to the airport, and have a selection of cold champagne and prosecco to serve on the roof top. If you want to walk everywhere in this museum of a city, you cannot be disappointed if you stay here. Booking far ahead is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Kaandz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 6-night stay in Rome. The Hotel Parlamento exceeded our expectations. It is located in a very safe and centrally located area of the city, within walking distance of most of the tourist sites. Although the front lobby was still under construction, the work did not bother us. The staff were exceptionally accommodating and helpful with all of our requests. The rates were quite reasonable compared with other hotels in the area. Our room was very clean and larger than I expected. Its windows were on the street and therefore somewhat noisy in the morning, but the rooms upstairs seem quieter. The balcony on the roof is nice, although it was still too cool for us to eat out there in the morning. Overall, we would highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and helpful employees”
Reviews.Author: pinaykat
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parlamento was a cute little hotel very close to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish steps. The employees spoke great English and were very helpful. My brother and I took the offer for them to get a car to and from the airport. It's $55 from and $45 to the airport. Although it sucked 'cause we were told we didn't have to pay more over the $45 after getting to the airport, but the driver charged us more anyways. Our room was adequate. A typical sleeping room, but the bathroom was nicely decorated with marble, and the towel warmer was nice too. When we got there, the man at the desk gave us a room with a jacuzzi tub, which was awesome after walking all day. The showers were great, but we really had to watch to make sure we didn't wet the entire bathroom because there is only a short piece of glass to block the water from getting everywhere. We noticed this was the shower style all over Europe though. It was a nice time, we were glad to be able to watch CNN on the small mounted TV. It would have been nice if it was closer to a metro station, but it was a nice location nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “"No Price"”
Reviews.Author: giacomor
Reviews.Content: My title is a use of a rating I heard an Italian in Rome give to someone about an experience he had. It means the value is higher than "Priceless". It means you cannot put a price on it. From the moment we called for a reservation until we checked out, Signore Chini and staff , were main contributors to a truly happy "Roman Holiday" that was a "No Price" exerience. A trip to Rome should begin by calling Hotel Parlamento. The reservation service is just the tip off of a fine Roman experience. Signore Chini and staff could not be more pleasant, helpful, knowledgeableof Rome or accomodating. The Hotel is much better Hotel than a two star classification. The rooms are most tastefully appointed and accomodating. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was excellent for my wife and I. The breakfast area,food and staff provided a cheerful begining to our day. The rooftop terrace provided a great place for a mid-day respite and to end the day. Signore Chini et al provided accurate recommendations for eating, travelling around Rome, sightseeing and doing things "Piano, piano". All of the above eliminated the effects of the renovation activties that were going on. As for the Hotel's location, 'No Price". Short and easy walking to almost all areas of interest . Central location for public transportation. We fell in love with the small electric bus #116 that stops just accross via Corso and accross from the Italian Parlament. The Staff made convenient arrangements for our 5:00 A.M. deparure from the Hotel to Leonardo Da Vinci airport. Our three coins in the Trevi Fountain will bring us back to Rome. When we return, we will stay at Hotel Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: So&Bapt
Reviews.Content: We stayed there after having read reviews on Trip Advisor. The location is just great, just between Plaza di Spagna and the Pantheon. Staff is very helpful. Rooms are not so "new", a little old-fashion, but they are clean. Will probably stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Close To Everything”
Reviews.Author: onestepbeyond
Reviews.Content: Great bed and breakfast! My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Parlamento in early November and found it to be excellent value for money. We stayed in room 108 in particular as it has a private balcony and easy access to the other balcony in the hotel. 108 is normally used as a triple, but I wanted some space. I did manage to get a peek into the other rooms if the door was open and they all seemed very spacious and nice! The furniture and fixtures were fine, the maid service excellent, the breakfast was typical of Italy, with excellent coffee, yogurt, croissants, bread. We were fortunate as the weather was fantastic and obviously November is a great time of the year to stay in Rome as the tourists levels are slightly lower. I had selected this hotel based on reviews on Conde Nast Traveller and on this site. I would definitely stay there again with my husband or with our kids. It is very difficult to find a really comfortable hotel smack in the centre of Rome for the money. Literally you are 2 minutes from the Pantheon and the Piazza Navona; or the Spanish Steps in the other direction. After a day of walking you just want to chill in a nice area for the evening and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who prefers a bed and breakfast with a personal touch. Paolo, Tiziano, Andrea and Mr Chini were all exceptionally helpful as well. I really felt that they cared about our stay which made our trip really remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner”
Reviews.Author: sukicart
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it once you get up to the hotel itself as there are construction materials on the ground floor and a flight of stairs before arriving at the elevator which takes you to the lobby. From their it's all uphill. The staff couldn't be friendlier or more interested in your welfare & safety. They go out of their way to help with anything and everything. The hotel is in a prime location close to many tourist sites and less than a block from a major bus stop. The rooms are typical small European rooms, but they are clean and look as if they have recently been redone. The roof patio is a real plus here as it's nice for breakfast, cocktails and often dinner after a big Italian lunch. A great place to relax after a hectic day. This was my third trip to Rome and this is definately my favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parlamento Update”
Reviews.Author: Lagunatrips
Reviews.Content: We are two couples who spent a week at the hotel in early Oct. I was very concerned about the construction and it is a non issue. The hotel uses the top floors of this building and the construction material is on the ground floor. Yes, it looks like a war zone when you arrive but you are no where near it. The staff is wonderful and the location is perfect. The breakfast is adequate and the coffee is marginal;however, for 160 euro's this place is a great value. They have excellent coffee around the corner for 1 euro and with the money you are saving on the room go get your own. The patio is the best part of the hotel and we had a great time reviewing our day over some wine. Rooms in this price range are usually small and need a little painting;however, you are in Rome not the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not great”
Reviews.Author: mysterytrain
Reviews.Content: I wish I could whole-heartedly recommend the Parlamento, but it has several strikes against it. On the plus side, it has a fantastic location just off the Corso making it convenient to everything. There's a nice little roof top terrace, the staff are quite friendly (especially the two younger desk clerks) and the rooms are well-appointed if a bit small. They also seemed at pains to include some luxury hotel niceties -- like a Jacuzzi shower -- these things were pretty unnecessary, but I could see that they were really striving to shake off their pensione roots and become a real hotel. The first problem is that the hotel's building is undergoing major renovation so the outside is in shambles and there's scaffolding and construction materials everywhere (including around the otherwise lovely rooftop terrace). The hotel clerk we talked to said that the construction company swears they'll be done in two months – but apparently that's what they said back in March, too. Aside from the noise and the mess, this was also problematic because we couldn't open one set of our windows because of the scaffolding and since the rooms don't come with AC this was problematic in hot and humid Rome. Breakfast was another downer. They serve coffee American style (e.g., brewed in an industrial machine) – think stale truck stop coffee. It was wretched -- and what greater sin is there than to drink bad coffee in Rome? Fortunately, the two great coffee temples of Rome, Caffe Sant'Eustachio and La Tazza D'Oro are just a few minutes away so skip breakfast at the hotel and stand at the bar with the Romans. Finally, the hotel seemed a bit overpriced for what it is. Sure, the location was great, but the room was small and what with all the other drawbacks, it just didn’t quite seem worth the 160 E a night we paid for our double. I don't have much experience with Rome hotels so maybe that's not very much, but I expected something just a bit nicer for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Place with Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: DeborahATL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Parlamento is modest but comfortable and friendly with the most perfect location you can have in Rome. There is construction going on, not only on the hotel but on the whole block with scafolding on the front, all sides and the courtyard but there is no noise or problems and it looks like it may be some time before the work is complete. Accommodations are comfortable although nothing fancy. What was out of the ordinary was the staff. Everyone we encountered at this small family run hotel was exceptional. They were always so pleasant, helpful, and cheerful. And the location is also exceptional. It is walking distance to all the major sites with closest ones being the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps and Campo di Fiori. The longest walk is the Vatican, about a 30 minute walk, and the coloseum, about 20 minutes away. There are lots of great restaurants and shops just steps from the hotel. I have no complaints whatsoever about Hotel Parlamento. I would definitely stay there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel, great location for exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: Pitch_the
Reviews.Content: Great location, just off main shopping street (de Corso). Visited all the sights by foot from the hotel; longest walk would be to Vatican c.30 minutes. Hotel itself is nice and small with 24 hour reception with friendly and welcoming advice. To get to hotel itself, you go through a courtyard and up 2 flights of stairs to lift. We stayed in a double room off the roof courtyard. The room itself is of adequate size and the bathroom was modern, clean and I didnt find it too small (we had a bath). The roof courtyard is a great bonus as is great spot for having the breakfast in the morning (croissants, rolls, superb coffee) and for chilling in evening before dinner. The courtyard is open to all staying at the hotel and not just those staying in courtyard rooms. During our stay they were repainting the building and re-doing the roof. I have to honestly say it didnt effect our stay except for one afternoon when we couldnt get out onto the courtyard as they were painting. Aircon costs extra and was needed as the weather was a hot 28-31C and humid. Overall I would recommend this hotel, is great value and in a great location minutes from Spanish Steps and Trevi. Tried to book for the in-laws for October anniversary but is unfortunately is booked out. Would return ourselves to stay at Parlamento. Rome is a great city; best we have visited so far.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: fiddlewhiz1
Reviews.Content: I came to Rome with a class from my college in late May of 2006. The location was perfect, only blocks from Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon and right off Via Del Corso, which is a great place to shop. All staff members were friendly, fun, and incredibly helpful to our group of 33 college students. They were always there to provide us with maps or directions.The hotel is quaint and clean with a great breakfast served each morning. It is true that there was no air conditioning, but I am a very finicky sleeper and I slept easily with the window open. I plan to stay here whenever I return to Rome and would recommend it to anyone else who wanted the experience of staying in an authentic little hotel in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Vrbenica-Borderman
Reviews.Content: I first found the Hotel Parlamento in February, 2000 while on my days off from working for the UN in Kosovo. The room was comforatable and the staff excellent. They showed a personal interest in my visit and their recommendations for dining and touring were always right on the mark. So much so, that I sought out their advise for the day's activity. In 2002 I returned with my new Wife, her Step Father, and my Mother. They loved the place and found it quit cozy and perfectly suited for our needs. The staff again was great providing us with airport pickup (and delivery). Even though we had arranged a tour online to Assisi prior to arriving, they made sure the connections were made and all went well. July 23, 2006, my Brother took his family to Rome while he had a business meeting. Paralmento was my recommendation to them until they could check into the much more expensive and five star hotel provided by the business. Their stay was so good at the Parlamento that he called from the airport on his way home to tell me that the Parlamento was right on the money for the place to stay. His family all enjoyed their stay and loved the service and attention of the staff. Their room off of the elevator brought no complaints. All have told me that they wished the had not left the Parlamento and gone to the larger hotel, because everytime they went anywhere, they went past the Parlamento to get there. I recommend the Parlamento to everyone seeking a good location and resonably priced hotel in the grand city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TXBrowns
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Parlamento after taking a 10 hour overnight train from Paris. The train is another story! Never again! Anyway, our family of 4 departed the train station looking like shiny tourists. Griswald-like (2 adults, 2 teens). We were quickly approached by several taxi drivers all speaking italian. We showed them our map to the hotel and they quoted us 70 euro. We "stupidly" agreed. The owner of Hotel Parlamento met us at the entrance asking how much did we pay. When we told him, he chased the taxi away yelling thief!! We should have paid about 30-40 euro! The only benefit was that we didn't have to stand in the taxi line waiting for a "legal" driver... Although the hotel was under construction, we managed to get our suitcases up the stairs 3-4 flights. The elevator is teeny tiny. We opted to pay the extra 12 euro for air conditioning. Very cool. The rooms were immaculate. The bedding very clean and comfortable. The staff always available, knowledgeable and friendly. They made dinner reservations for us and called for legal taxis. Breakfast was pleasant, just enough to get you out the door; coffee, biscotti, croissants, jam, juice & coffee. The rooms were small , but I don't think you are there to stay in the room. The location was awesome. We walked everywhere, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Coliseum. We took a taxi to the Vatican to meet a tour guide we met earlier at the Coliseum. He was British and his name was Tony. He is a professional archeologist and is a wealth of history! We ate at Hard Rock cafe. HR Rome has the best memoribilia (John Lennon, Tom Petty, Madonna, Wham, U2, Springsteen, much much more than most HRs) We also ate at a restaurant Cisterna (across the river). Great dinner, complimentary champagne from the owner's vineyard along with mucho vino! It is built on an ancient prison with lots of history. If you ask your waiter, he will take you downstairs after dinner. The weather was hot hot hot. No AC in taxis or most restaurants. Fall/Spring would be a better time to visit. We would love to return to Italy someday. If we do, we would definitely consider Hotel Parlamento for location, hospitality, cleanliness, well priced!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scottflex
Reviews.Content: After reading that the Hotel Parlamento was a 4 star hotel with 2 star prices, I'm not sure where these travellers have been, but I'm sorry....it's a 1 star hotel at 2 star prices. We were warned that the building would be under construction, but never expected that the entrance would be so filthy. No help with the luggage, as you must climb 2 flights of stairs to reach their elevator. The lobby( reception area) is disgraceful and needs a huge cleanup. Greeted by a person who led us to our room. The room was dark and gloomy. Thank god it was only to sleep. The room was clean.....but that's about it. Bed and pillows were very uncomfortable. Breakfast was okay, even though the day staff refused to put on the AC in the commune areas during the day and it was HOT as an oven. The staff (young lady from Madagascar)serving breakfast were sweet and looked after the guests well. I would never recommend this hotel. The location is great, I must admit. There was another hotel in the same building called Hotel Montecitorio, lobby looked great. You might want to check it out. [--] Loved Rome, it's a fabulous city. Great restaurants to discover. We found a little restaurant called Ristorante Quirino, Via Muratte 84 , half a block from the Trevi Fountain. The best Spagetti Carbonara we have ever had!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Hotel Parlamento!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon58
Reviews.Content: Based on a Frommer's recommendation and comments on Trip Advisor, we booked a stay at Hotel Parlamento in Rome. It was our first stop on a 3-week trip, so we arrived pretty exhausted after a long flight from California. Let me preface my comments by saying that we like family-run, budget hotels and between Frommer's and Rick Steve have always been happy with the accommodations we have booked. Hotel Parlamento was our first HUGE disappointment! Although it is a great location and reasonably priced, I would have gladly paid more for a more positive experience. We were given room #74 which is right off the reception area, so we could not get any rest because of all the noise both day and night. Late into the night the door buzzer would ring and all day long people were checking in and out. We immediately asked for a different room, but were told by "Tiziano" that he would have to check the next day. We paid extra for air-conditioning as it was very hot in Rome. That night, the air conditioning didn't work, so we had to sleep with the window open, creating even more noise from the traffic on Via del Corso. Also, there was no hot water for showers. The next morning, "Tiziano" told me that I had broken the air-conditioner by hitting a wrong button on the remote control. He had a very arrogant attitude, but he did tell us to pack up our bags and they would move them to a new room while we went off to tour the Borghese Gallery. Later that afternoon, when we arrived back at the hotel hot and tired, they still had us in room 74 and said there were no other rooms available. They told us that they had fixed the air-conditioner...that the motor had burned out. If we were not so exhausted, we would have looked for another hotel. The next afternoon, we came back to the hotel to find a very rude and grumpy older gentleman at the desk. I politely asked him for our room key and he yelled at me and said we had clogged the toilet and accused us of putting things down it! How mortifying! The toilet had worked perfectly when we had left that morning. The only bright spot of our stay was Andrea, who had to be at the desk all night. He was so charming and humble and did all he could to help us fix the air-conditioner at 2am. After 3 nights, we moved to a wonderful hotel further east, but still a great location...Hotel Nardizi...what a difference...the staff was delightful...the rooms were beautiful and quiet. Please, think twice before you book at Hotel Parlamento. We try to be humble, polite guests when we travel, but the arrogant attitudes at Hotel Parlamento would anger and demoralize even the most humble traveler. Boun Viaggio.

Reviews.Title: “The owners were great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered a service to have you picked up at the airport for 50 Euros. It was the perfect way to get to the hotel. The brothers on the desk could not have been more helpful. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom solid granite. We found the room quiet and the terrace for all to use was a terrific place to have a glass of wine before dinner. THE LOCATION WAS FANTASTIC!!! I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: pierogi
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here in June 2006. We paid extra for the air conditioning, which was worth it given the Rome heat. The location could not have been better. The kids had two good beds in small attached room (no doorway separating). The air conditioner did not reach this room well, by the way. The breakfast was very adequate. The staff at the front desk was very helpful with recommendations for dinners, advice on how to get around, setting up airport ride, etc. The rooms and bathroom were small but adequate. Minuses: The shower stall was moldly around the edges--yuck--the reason for my reduced review rating. The elevator is very limited--stairs to reach it, and stairs to reach the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Star Hotel at Two Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: Th0mps0n
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Parlamento (Via delle Convertite 5) has a really great location, about a 5 - 7 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the Spagna subway station through streets lined with elegant shops. The included Continental breakfast is excellent and lovingly served. The comfortable rooms are all ensuite, with large bureau, desk and chair, and end tables alongside the bed. Some rooms have a separate sitting room and veranda and all rooms have TV, safe, and hair dryer. You can have your breakfast, weather permitting, on the lovely roof garden. The staff all have idiomatic English, are charming (great senses of humor), and are extremely knowledgeable and helpful to the tourist. They know the bus lines (a terminus is only a few minutes walk) and graciously book transportation both to and from the Rome airport. The restaurants they will recommend are nearby and reasonably priced. You do have to ascend two flights of stairs, 12 steps each, to reach the elevator that takes you to the hotel reception desk. A budget-minded tourist will find this Hotel an outstanding bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Our Roman Home We Love You!!!”
Reviews.Author: Babe
Reviews.Content: My sons and I stayed at the Hotel Parlamento for the second time in two years, and I can't wait to go back again next year!!! Who cares if the elevator is tiny (how much time do you plan to spend in the elevator anyway?)? And how hard is it to find the stairs that go UP? The Hotel Parlamento staff is warm, welcoming and friendly. They always had time to spare to help us find our way, and they didn't even mind when my son seemed determined to eat all the little tiny mints in the desk bowl! Thanks guys for the afternoon discussions (world travel) and morning talks (motorcycles and GP racing!!). We look forward to seeing you again next year!! Wendy Anderson Detroit, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied once past the entrance”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome, and we picked Hotel Parlamento based on Trip Advisor reviews, location, and price. Fortunately, since we were arriving at night, we had them send someone to pick us up at the airport. That was 50 euros well spent. The airport is way out of town, and there was construction on the highway. Took us over an hour to get in, but the driver was waiting for us (flight was delayed), and had a lovely new car. The hotel is in a fabulous, central location. We walked everywhere - including the Vatican (about 45 minutes).But the building is being renovated (probably through December, we were told). There is scaffolding around the outside and only a small sign on a pillar in front with the name of the hotel. At night, you buzz to get in. I don't think we would have found it if we had been on our own at night.The entry (also under renovation) goes to the main building, and the hotel entrance is through a courtyard (yup, being done) to the right. There is another hotel entrance to the left. Once you go through the courtyard (which is only open at the top of where the buildings meet, so is very dark), you have two flights of stairs, then a very small elevator (one person, two suitcases), then another flight of stairs. A little daunting. However.... Our room was quite comfortable with private bath. Shower is indeed small, but more a problem of getting in and out because it was located next to a cabinet. The stairs and the size of the shower would only preclude someone of "size" from enjoying the hotel. The room we were given opened to the rooftop (more construction), but there was access to the tables and chairs. Since this was early March, it was damp and chilly, and we really didn't use it. In another season, I'm sure it would be great. Bed was comfortable, towels were just fine (we had been warned they would be very small, but weren't.) Breakfast was downstairs, with the best capuccino(made to order) we had on our 3-week trip. Croissants, canned fruit, other crackers and things. Just fine to get your day started. Hotel staff was very helpful. Someone was there at all times. Even helped us ship "dress-up" clothes to Monaco for a family party we were going to attend in two weeks and didn't want to drag extra stuff around. We paid 125 euros a night (and stayed for 6 nights), and I looked for a lot of places. Based on the comfort of the room, the helpfulness of the staff, and the excellent location, I would easily recommend the hotel. But for the rest of the year, be prepared for a very strange entrance to the Hotel Parlamento.

Reviews.Title: “i just loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: edlara
Reviews.Content: i just comeback from 1 week stay in Rome and i strongly recomend hotel patlamento,all the guys in the reception desk and the lady serving the breakfast were very friendly,very clean rooms and because is located in a very central area you can walk everywhere!! and besides there are police almost every corner becauase is also very close to the italian parlament building so you can walk no matter the time.Right now there are workers doing some repairs to the building outside but are from 8 to 5 so believe me if you go to Rome you'll never gonna be at the hotel at this times.If i come back to Rome sure thing i'll stay in Hotel Parlamento

Reviews.Title: “Sooo friendly”
Reviews.Author: JNettie
Reviews.Content: What we loved best about the Hotel Parlamento was the hospitality- everyone made us feel welcome, told us about great sites to see, and made us feel at home. The location was great- we walk a lot everywhere we go and made it to Ancient Rome on foot no problem, plus we were very close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. The hotel room itself was quite pleasant- decent size with a great shower. The continental breakfast was a great way to start the day- with fresh croissants and rolls, juice, coffee and hot chocolate, and fruit. The only downside we experienced was one very loud family, and due to the small size of the hotel, their voices and laughter (at 7 am when I still like to sleep when on vacation) really carried. If you stay here, please remember to be considerate of other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: CJBab
Reviews.Content: When the cab dropped us off I thought there was a mistake: just a dark street with narrow sidewalk and a huge pair of dark wooden doors facing us. But once we buzzed in it was fine. (We now know such a set up is common in Italy). The location is terrific (Via del Corso near the Marcus Aurelius monument). Easy walk to all central landmarks. Metro is an easy walk at Spanish Steps. We had a standard double room right behind the reception area. We had booked a terrace room, but construction caused them to change us to a standard double--with notice. For the compensatory rate (80 eu) we were happy with the accommodations. Room was reasonable size, bath was comfortable for one person, not 2, but there was a little dressing area w/ mirror just outside the bath. The staff kindly noticed I'd "fluffed up" my thin pillow by putting a blanket under it...the next night she had put another pillow on my bed. Nice touch. We were so travel weary when we got there that we totally missed the elevator and lugged our bags up all 5 floors! (The lift is at the 3rd turn in the stairs). The staff were polite and helpful with reservations and other information. Breakfast was basic, but they did provide us a tray of coffee to bring to the room. We paid in euros with no problem. If you're looking for a reasonable, clean room in a great location, this is the place. ------ Note: They showed me the terrace rooms and I would gladly return to stay in one of them. There are 3: one with "ya-koot-zi" bath/shower. Of the others, one had shower only and the other was jacuzzi shower. The terrace was nicer than I'd expected. Breakfast is served there, but it's private to those rooms after 10am. They are refurbishing the little courtyard with a fountain and other touches. He said prices will be going up after construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Fiona949
Reviews.Content: Yes it's a reasonable place to stay. Clean, decent shower, pleasant staff, excellent location and well-priced. I have stayed here three times over the years. I wouldn't rave about it though- it's not some kind of magic gem. When I stayed here just before Christmas 2005, every morning we were woken before 7 by building work. You expect noise in a city, but not to have them working directly in the courtyard of the building you are trying to sleep in. Light sleepers might enquire when this work finished before they book. As the hotel entrance is not directly on the street (but up several flights of stairs), in the evening you have to buzz to be let in- and this took a while one night, standing there buzzing for ten minutes trying to get in. Breakfast is the standard for cheap places like this- tinned fruit, rolls, fake cheese, weak hot chocolate. Not a disappointment at these prices but you could get something much better for half the price at the local cafe. And finally, they do that swiz when you check out of billing you in GBP not euros, at their (inevitably unfavourable) conversion rate. All requests to pay the bill in euros met with a blank. I have given this hotel an 'above average' rating overall, on account of the price and the location, but it's not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: traveling_mom_Boston
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with 3 kids ages 13, 8 and 5. I needed a clean, reasonably priced hotel close to everything with 4 beds. Most places don't have 4 beds. This hotel fit the bill. Our double bedded room had an alcove with 2 single beds and our own patio/balcony. It was basic but clean with AC (we stayed for 6 days in Aug). We could walk to almost everything. The staff was wonderful. I had a death in the family and had to leave suddenly and my husband came to be with the kids and the staff was very helpful. They also made sure we had a taxi waiting for us at the airport since we arrived at the other one very late at night. I recommend this hotel to all our friends traveling to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: JudyANewYork
Reviews.Content: The Parlamento is excellent value for money. Although the facilities are basic, all basic needs are met. We found the staff very friendly, helpful, and responsive. And the location simply can't be beat. A real find.
